loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca K. is 37 years old and married to James K., who is a 45-year-old policeman. They live in Kabarnet Town. They have been blessed with three children: Hezbon (14 years old and in Form 2), Faith (12 years old and in Class 8) and Tony (9 years old and in Class 5).

Mrs. Prisca K. runs an agro-vet shop. She started this business 10 years ago. She gets a profit of 8,000 Kenyan shillings per month and an additional income of Kshs 3,000 from other sources.

She has borrowed Kshs 70,000 for her second loan from KADET, a Kiva partner. She plans to use Kshs 28,000 to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer. She will use the balance for tilling and renting land.

Prisca has never borrowed a loan from any other financial institution other than KADET. Existing clients introduced her to KADET. Prisca’s business is near a Tobil Petrol Station. Most of her customers are farmers in Kabarnet Town and its vicinity.

If this loan boosts her business, she will use the extra income to expand her maize-farming business. She dreams and hopes of expanding the agro-vet business and purchasing a plot of land, which she will develop. She describes herself as hardworking and creative.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Unidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidad está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, decididas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Rosa Argentina C. quien tiene un pequeño kiosco en el colegio veinticinco de septiembre donde comercializa desde gaseosas, emparedados, tajadas con queso y chiverias. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Cecilia J. comenzó vendiendo unos cuantos productos como gaseosa, huevos, pan, fósforos y chiverías con lo cual poco a poco fue formando una pequeña pulpería y Gloria Elena S. es propietaria de una panadería donde realiza desde pan simple, con queso, dulce,  reposterías etc.
Ellas invertirán el crédito para mejorar sus negocios y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
The group Unity is comprised of three hard-working, decisive, and entrepreneurial women. The coordinator of the group is Rosa Argentina C., who has a small kiosk at the 20th of September School where she sells sodas, sandwiches, plantains with fried cheese and miscellany. Her associates in the group include Cecilia J., who started selling some products such as sodas, eggs, bread, matches and more, which slowly led her to start a small general store. Also, Gloria Elena S. owns a bakery where she sells plain bread, with cheese, sweet, desserts, etc. They will invest the loan into improving their businesses and to continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as sodas, bread, etc.

loans.name: Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco  Comunal Cumbe está conformado por un grupo de 12 señoras luchadoras y dispuestas a salir adelante junto a sus familias, viven en la parroquia  Cumbe que se encuentra a 24 kilómetros al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta parroquia presentan viviendas mezcla de europeo, americano y las típicas  de la región con paredes de adobe, columnas, pilastras, puertas y ventanas de madera, pisos de ladrillo y madera,  con estructura de madera y revestimiento de teja tradicional formando un singular paisaje mezcla de culturas.  Cumbe también ofrece al visitante lugares muy especiales para la recreación como el mirador El Calvario a 5 minutos en auto y 15 caminando del centro parroquial,  el Gulash  entre Santa Rosa, Cumbe y Jima, Pucará de la Geografía Sagrada de los Cañaris, las orillas del río Cumbe y las ruinas de Ingahuasi en el ascenso a Tinajillas.

María Lucrecia León es una mujer  casada,  tiene 62 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos que ya son casados y viven de manera independiente,  su esposo trabaja en la rama de la construcción y gracias al esfuerzo del trabajo en su juventud han logrado construir su casa  compartiendo con  dos nietos que le hacen compañía.

María Lucrecia se dedica a la venta de animales como chanchos y gallinas que  los vende en su  comunidad, también cuida de una vaca y la leche que obtiene la vende y un poco es para el consumo de su hogar.  Es socia de éste banco comunal  hace cuatro  años  y todos los créditos  anteriores ha invertido en su  negocio, con su nuevo  préstamo comprará más chanchos y gallinas para incrementar su criadero de animales.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Al igual que las  otras socias del banco comunal la señora  Rosa G. vive en la comunidad  del mismo nombre de su banco del que formó parte hace un ciclo incentivada por su cuñada, ella  se dedica  a la compra y venta  de chanchos y gallinas labor que realiza hace 24 años y fue gracias a su cuñada que ingreso a esta actividad, los días martes, miércoles y jueves son los días que se dedica a la venta de los animales y los fines de semana vende en una picantería  de su propiedad en la cual labora desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 3:30 p.m. con su nuevo crédito va a comprar más chanchos y gallinas  para incrementar  su negocio y su meta es  aumentar  su picantería y hacerle de dos pisos.

Rosa tiene 47 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos que se encuentran de 26, 24, 12 su primer hijo trabaja y su sueldo es solo para sus gastos, su segunda hija le ayuda en la picantería y su último hijo estudia en la escuela de la localidad, su esposo se dedica al cuidado de su ganado, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Cumbe communal bank has 12 tenacious members who are determined to get ahead with their families. They live in Cumbe parish that is 24 kilometers south of the city of Cuenca. This parish has homes that are a mix of European, American and typical of the area construction styles. The latter have adobe walls and columns with wood windows and doors and floors of brick and wood; the structures are wood covered with traditional tile work giving the area a singular look blending several cultures. Cumbe also offers the visitor special recreational areas like El Calvario lookout which is a five minute drive or a 15 minute walk from the parish center, El Gulash which is between Cumbe and Jima, Pucará, a sacred archaeological site of the Cañaris people, the Cumbe river banks and the Ingahuasi ruins on the slope of Tinajillas Mountain. María Lucrecia León, 62, is married and has four children who are married and live independently; her husband works in construction and thanks to his efforts at work when he was young they managed to build their home which they share with two grandchildren who keep them company. María Lucrecia sells pigs and chickens in her community; she also cares for a cow whose milk she sells keeping some for personal home consumption. She has been a member of the communal bank for four years and she has invested all her previous loans in her business. She will use the new funds to buy more pigs and chickens to increase her animal nursery. Her goal is to continue growing in her business. Like the other group members, Rosa G. lives in Cumbe. She became a member a cycle ago thanks to her sister-in-law who encouraged her to join. She has raised pigs and chickens for sale for 24 years and it was thanks to her sister-in-law that she went into this kind of business. On Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays she sells the animals and on weekends she tends to an eatery she owns from 8am until 3:30pm. She will use the new loan to buy more pigs and chickens to enlarge her business. Her goal is to expand her eatery by adding a second story onto it. Rosa, 47, is married and has three children who are 26, 24 and 12 years of age. Her oldest is employed and uses his salary just for his own expenses. Her second daughter helps out in the eatery and the youngest is still in school. Her husband is a cattleman and his efforts have made it possible for him to build their house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more pigs and chickens.

loans.name: El Retoño Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Retoño” nombrado así por que antes era un restarurant granD. y ahora solo es una pequeño palapa hecha D. madera y laminas en los camellones chontales D. Nacajuca, en el Estado D. Tabasco. Está integrado por tres hombres y una mujer. Los representa  Martín B. H., es soltero, además D. ser socio del pequeño restaurant también trabaja D. vigilante por las noches. Timoteo B. H. tiene 2 hijos y trabaja en el restaurant y en un hotel D. L. ciudad D. Villahermosa. Martha B. H. hermana D. Timoteo, se dedica atender el negocio y Víctor Manuel B. D. L. C. que tiene 1 hijo, también se dedica a trabajar en una tienda comercial además del restaurant. 

Timoteo, con su esposa y dos hijos, decidieron retomar el trabajo que se hacia en los camellones chontales, que son extensiones D. tierra “ganada” a las lagunas. El grupo, solicita el crédito para comprar material para construir baños y remodelar el local (cemento, block, arena) y comprar ingredientes para L. elaboración D. sus platillos como: cokteles, ensaladas D. camarón, tortillas, etc. Y dar mantenimiento a L. alberca. Sueñan con tener una buena infraestructura, más sillas, mesas para acondicionar mejor el lugar y ofrecer así un mejor servicio a los clientes D. los municipios D. Nacajuca, Comalcalco, cunduacan, Villahermosa e incluso del país. Poner más palapas, cabañas y juegos infantiles. 

Son un grupo entusiasta, muy unidos, emprendedores con deseos D. superarse y tener un  negocio rentable y ofrecer un buen servicio D. restaurant,  es un grupo solidario y se conocen desD. hace años.  

Están muy contentos por L. ayuda que  le brinda L. Fundación y KIVA al creer en ellos y otorgarles un crédito que les servirá para invertirlo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The group “El Retoño” is named after a large restaurant that previously existed, but is now housed in a small palapa hut maD. of wood and metal sheeting located on a Chontal reservation in the State of Tabasco. The members consist of three men and one woman. Martín B. H. is the group representative. He is single and a partner of this small restaurant, but he also works at night as a security guard. Timoteo B. H. has two children and works at the restaurant and also at a hotel in the city of Villahermosa. Martha B. H. is Timoteo’s sister and manages the business. Víctor Manuel B. D. L. C. has one child and works at a retail store in addition to working at the restaurant.

Timoteo, along with his wife and two children, decided to reopen the restaurant upon acquiring some tracts of land near the lake. The group is requesting a loan to buy materials (cement, blocks, and sand) for building bathrooms and remodeling the entire structure as well as purchase ingredients for preparing dishes such as cocktails, shrimp salads, tortillas, and other items. The swimming pool will also be maintained. They dream of having a solid infrastructure plus additional chairs and tables so that they can proviD. a nicer atmosphere and better service to their customers who come from the towns of Nacajuca, Comalcalco, Cunduacan, Villahermosa, and other parts of the country. In addition, they hope to install more palapa stations, cabanas, and children’s games.

They are a very close and enthusiastic group. These entrepreneurs desire to succeed, have a profitable business, and offer good service in their restaurant. The members of this solidarity group have known each other for many years.

They are glad to have the assistance of Fundación Realidad and Kiva and are grateful for the belief in them by providing this loan so that they can invest in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for remodeling, ingredients, and pay for pool maintenance

loans.name: Nuris Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Nuris es madre de familia de dos hermosos hijos, madre esforzada y dedicada al trabajo, para lograr estabilidad. Junto con su esposo ha logrado construir su casa de concreto, aun de tierra, pero un techo digno.
Su esposo trabaja como conductor, y gana poco pero es un trabajo fijo, no ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa, ya que las ventas están bajas, aunque no se deja de vender, y las ganancias va rotando en compra de productos, gastos básicos de agua y luz, entre medicamentos para sus hijos que por el invierno se han enfermado.
Pero su anhelo es mejorar su piso para una mejor higiene, 
Con este préstamo comprara: granos básicos, golosinas, lácteos, carnes, pollo, productos enlatados, y verduras para lograr aumentar sus ventas y poder cubrir sus gastos. Contenta ya que a trabes de este medio sigue invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Nuris is a strong mother of two beautiful children who is dedicated to her job, selling food to achieve some stability. Together with her husband she was able to build a concrete house. Although it has a dirt floor, it is a dignified place. Her husband works as a driver, and his wages, though consistent, are low. They have not been able to make improvements to their home since Nuris' sales are low, although she hasn't stopped trying, and the money she makes goes back into buying products and paying for basic services like water and electricity, along with medication for her children, who were sick during the winter. Her goal is to improve her home's floor to make it more hygienic. With the loan she is requesting, Nuris plans to purchase basic grains, snacks, dairy products, meats, chicken, canned goods and vegetables so she can increase her sales and cover her expenses. She is happy because in this way she can continue investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, snacks, dairy products, meats, chicken, canned goods and vegetables

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria  A. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Lag-it, Brgy. Okiot, Bais City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two businesses:  a general Store and a fishing business. Her husband Apolinario A., who is 60 years-old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 22 years-old. 

Victoria  joined Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Victoria  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 19th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her sari sari store so that she can continue to save up for the future and to provide additional capital for her business. Victoria  A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han H., 50, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for being the favorite tourist place in the country. H. and her husband are farmers and also raise pigs, earning an income of USD 3 each per day.

H. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to use for commuting

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet T. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 28 years old and married with two small children. To make a living, Juliet catches and sells ocean fish. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juliet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her arable land and buy inputs

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel E. is from the village of Soyung Echague. She is 27 years old and is married with one infant child. Maricel owns and operates a specialized retail store selling cosmetics products. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Maricel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Reli Group

texts.en:
Michael A. is in his early thirties and is married with three children. Michael owns a photography business which he has been running for 5 years now. The shop is open daily and earns Michael a good monthly profit.

This will be Michael's 2nd loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Michael used his previous loan to contribute to buying a new camera. Michael has since successfully repaid this loan. Michael aims to use his 2nd loan to buy a new flash for his camera in order to improve the quality of his pictures. Michael's dream is to one day open an office from where he can organise and run his business.

Michael will share this loan with his loan group Reli, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Michael can be seen in the middle in the back row.

loans.use: To buy a new flash for his camera.

loans.name: Blesida

texts.en: Blesida C. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling canned goods, coffee and chocolate drink in sachet, as well as chicharron (fried pork rinds) in her community. She is 52 years old, married and has six grown-up children. She is from the village of Poblacion, Valencia City, Bukidnon. Blesida has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Blesida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Blesida is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia V., 65, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ulpiano V. and mother to four young hard-working adults. By the grace of God, Delia has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Delia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at a piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages, etc. to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Delia dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla M. is a single man who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is transportation.

Abdalla has operated a business selling bananas and oranges for over two months at the market and from door to door. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Abdalla faces a major challenge in the form of transportation. High cost is incurred when moving from door to door selling fruit. He hopes to open a fruit stand in the future.

Abdalla decided to join Yehu to get loans to lift his living standards. With his 20,000 KES loan he wants to purchase iron sheeting to build a sales structure.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets to build a sales structure.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: El Señor Isidro tiene 41 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Además de ser una buen padre responsable el se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, tiene su local en su vivienda en donde es visitado por una gran variedad de clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8 hasta las 9 de la noche pues tiene que andar un diferentes comarcas para buscar al mejor cerdo Este crédito es para comprar cerdos ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y tiene una gran variedad de clientes. Su meta es proporcionar una gran variedad de cerdos.
texts.en: Isidro is 41 years old, he is married and he has 3 young children who are still in his care. Aside from being a good and responsible father, he is also buys and sells livestock. He has a store in his house where a great variety of people come to buy. He works every day form 8 to 9 at night.  He goes out to various stables to find the best heads of livestock. This loan will be used to purchase pigs to get ready for the Christmas season when his clients increase. His goal is to be able to supply a variety of livestock.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Antonia Floridalva

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

La señora Antonia esta en el Banco Comunal casi desde el principio hace 38 ciclos  y le gusta por las facilidades que presta la institución para dar los créditos. Tiene 62 años, está divorciada y de esa relación que tuvo procreo  4 hijos  todos son mayores de edad, es modista aprendió corte y confección en una Academia en la ciudad de Manta.

Ella es modista tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde cose todo tipo de ropa pero lo que más confecciona es ropa para damas,  y también nos cuenta que hace ropa para niños, una de sus hijas que vive cerca de su casa le ayuda en su tarea cuando tiene mucho trabajo. Trabaja todos los días unas seis horas por día. Ella realiza obras a personas que requieren de sus servicios y son muchos los que llegan hasta su taller.

Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar materiales para la  costura. Sus sueños son  tener salud para seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres en Acción' (Women in Action) community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Antonia has been a member of her community bank almost since the beginning, 38 loan cycles ago.  She likes her community bank for the ease with which the institution provides loans.  Antonia is 62 years old.  She is divorced and has 4 grown-up children from her relationship.  She is a dressmaker and she learned dressmaking in an Academy in the city of Manta.

Antonia is a dressmaker and has a small dressmaking workshop in her house where she sews all kinds of clothes.  What she makes the most of is ladies' clothes.  She also tells us that she makes children's clothes.  One of her daughters lives nearby and she helps her when she has a lot of work on.  Antonia works six hours every day.  She does work for people who require her services and a lot of people come to her workshop.

She will use this loan to buy materials for her dressmaking business.  Her dream is to continue to enjoy good health so that she can continue in her work.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 46 years old, is a married woman from the town of Banga. She has five children who go to school. She grows rice and corn crops. Her husband is also a farmer and they both do their best to keep the farm productive. Ruth sells their harvest to the market. Ruth wants to be able to sustain her children's education until college. She wants them to have bright futures.

Ruth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.

Aquí encontramos a la señora María, ella está en  el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  hace dos ciclos ya que este es un Banco nuevo y dice que está muy a gusto porque ha recibido muchos beneficios de parte de la Fundación Espoir para sacar su negocio adelante. Tiene 28 años, está divorciada y tiene un hijo de 3 años, ella tiene un titulo de Lic. En enfermería.

Se dedica a la venta productos por Avon, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catalogo, trabaja todos los días unas dos horas al dia, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, deja a crédito  y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los maquillajes y lleva en esta actividad  siete años y que este negocio le ha servido de mucho para sacar a su pequeño hijo adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas, ropa,  entre otros productos. Sus sueños son tener un carro y un trabajo en su profesión.
texts.en:
The member of the communal bank named "Ecological Park" meet every two weeks in the community of San Eduardo in the city of Portoviejo. This location is known for its beautiful park which attracts tourists and individuals of the region wishing to pass the day surrounded by nature. 

Here we meet Maria. She has been a member of the communal bank for the past two loan cycles.  This is a newly formed communal bank and she feels very comfortable because she has received numerous benefits from Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) in support of her business. She is 28 years old, she is divorced, and she has a 3-year old son. She has a degree in nursing. 

She sells Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories).  She also sells clothing through a catalogue, working every day about two hours a day. She makes her sales by traveling from door to door and by taking orders. She completes her sales on credit, collecting weekly payments. She says that her biggest seller is makeup and she has had this business for the past seven years. This business has been a great help in supporting her son. 

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, skin lotions, clothing, and other products. Her dream is to have a car and a job in her profession.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Byambatsogt

texts.en:
Byambatsogt I., 45, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Harhorin, the ancient capital of the Mongolian empire. Two of his sons attend a local school. He is a certified carpenter and started his woodcraft business in 2005. He is a hardworking and modest person.

Byambatsogt and his wife work for a construction company in the summer and operate his business in the winter. He mostly makes wood furniture such as closets, cupboards, mirrors and windows. He also receives orders for parts for ger construction, a ger being a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. He makes his wood products in his own backyard.

Byambatsogt is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to get more wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: To get more wood and materials

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en:
Romanita H. is from Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old, widowed, and has 11 grown children. To make a living, Romanita owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling used clothing & shoes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Romanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used clothing to sell. This will be Romanita’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen members.  Mr. Sam, who was born in 1952, is the village bank president.  He was selected to be the group leader by the other members.  He and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice for supporting their family living. 

With this farm, they do not have enough money to grow rice on it.  Thus, Mr. Sam would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay laborers to grow rice.  Aside from farming, he is also a commune clerk who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. This couple has two children: one is a farmer and one is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to hire laborers for growing rice.

loans.name: Sope Serigne Barra1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BARRA1 est créé en 2006. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Elles partagent le même centre d'intérêt qui est le développement de leur terroir. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR MBAR.

Madame DIARRA S. (à droite de la photo vêtue de rose avec une pochette rouge à la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des amis et proches.

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle achète les moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires, les engraisse pendant au moins quatre mois avant de les revendre. 

Son crédit de 100.000 francs CFA lui permettra d'acheter 04 moutons pour réaliser son projet d'embouce. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses quotidiennes surtout en nourriture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group  SOPE SERIGNE BARRA1 was created in 2006. The group is made up of 15 women who are from the same village. They came together as neighbors and friends. All of them share the same interest: developing their land. 

The group is part of the Keur Mbar banc villageois. Mrs. Diarra S. (on the right in the photo, dressed in pink holding a red purse) is the group's leader. She is 25 years old, married and the mother of five children. She also takes care of 2 other children entrusted to her by close friends and family. Mrs. S. fattens sheep. She buys sheep at the weekly market, then fattens them for at least four months before re-selling them. Her loan of 100,000 CFA francs will allow her to buy 4 sheep for fattening. Her goal is to support her husband in meeting daily expenses, especially for food.

loans.use: To buy 4 sheep

loans.name: Benkola  (Soyons D’Accord) Group

texts.fr:
Benkola est un regroupement de femmes  quartier Koko de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont  toutes mariées et sont mères en moyenne de  5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habillements,  les céréales  les légumes, les condiments de toutes sortes etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés. 
Ramata Koné est un membre du groupe Benkola qui vend des habillements de toutes sortes : bazins, pagnes wax et des bogolans.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des pièces de bazins et pagnes wax à Bamako et des tissus à Bobo Dioulasso. Elle vend  ces articles en gros, en détail, à crédit et au comptant, au grand marché de Koutiala, à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkola comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Ramata Koné, compte réaliser 160 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcée ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Benkola is a group of women in the Koko district of Koutiala who live in large traditional families. They are all married and on average are 40 years old with 5 children.  This group of women sell various items such as clothing, grains, vegetables, and all sorts of condiments etc. In order to increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. This is their fourth group loan and all previous loans have been fully repaid.  Ramata Koné is a member of the Benkola group who sells all kinds of clothing made from damasks, wax pagnes (a wax-dyed fabric) and bogolans (hand-dyed fabric). She plans to use her loan to buy pieces of damask and wax pagne in Bamako and some fabrics in Bobo Dioulasso. She sells these items wholesale or retail, for credit and cash, at the Koutiala Grand Market to a diverse and varied clientele.
While the other members of the Benkola group hope to make an average profit of 140,000 CFA each during this cycle, Ramata Koné hopes to make 160,000 CFA. In addition to repaying the loans, they will use  part of their  income to provide for their families’ everyday expenses.They want to see this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso strengthened so that their stock doesn't become scarce.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Aniam

texts.en:
Aniam is from Israel's Negev region. She has brought an amazing business to her village, a book rental library store. From her home Aniam rents books and provides story times and reading programs for school children. She also has books for adults. Aniam's dream has enriched her entire village with access to reading.

Aniam needed this loan to expand her book collection and purchase shelves and supplies.

Her dream is to open a central rental library which will have a wide selection of literature, with reading programs for all ages and story times for youth.

loans.use: to expand her book collection and purchase shelves and supplies.

loans.name: Las Palmas Km 14  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Palmas KM 14 se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse  para formar este Banco Comunal y así tener acceso a los créditos para mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comida entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Mariana del Jesús M., tiene 31 años  de edad, es madre soltera de dos  hijos de 14 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y espera seguir por mucho tiempo al igual que sus compañeras.

Además de ser una gran madre también se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida rápida, tiene un pequeño puesto al borde de la carretera que une la ciudad de Portoviejo con la ciudad de Manta, en ese lugar ella vende empanadas, corviches, salchichas, cueritos asados, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes de 15h00 hasta las 19h00 en lo que es venta ya que en las mañanas ella se dedica a preparar estos deliciosos bocadillos que les encanta a las personas que transitan por la localidad. Nos cuenta que lleva 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que con esto ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar plátano verde, maní, carne, salchichas, papas, cuero de chancho, entre otras cosas necesarias en su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Las Palmas KM 14" meets every two weeks in the community of Montecristi. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts renowned at the national and international level. This is where the famous straw sombreros originate.

This group of people decided to come together to from a communal bank and so to have access to loans to improve their small businesses. They have various business types, including, commerce, services, food sales, and other activities. 

Here we meet Mrs. Mariana del Jesus M.. She is 31 year old and she is a single mother of two children, aged 14 and 3. The eldest is in school. This is her first loan cycle with the communal bank and she hopes to keep up for a long time, as her colleagues also wish. She also wants to be a great mother. She prepares and sells fast foods. She has a small stand along the stretch of road that links the city of Portoviejo to the city of Manta. She sells turnovers, deep-fried bananas, sausages, pork rinds and other foods. She works every day in the afternoons from 3pm to 7pm. In the mornings she prepares the delicious snacks that passers-by love to eat. She says that she has 10 years' experience in the business and this is how she has been able to support her children. 

This loan will be used to purchase green bananas, peanuts, meats, sausages, potatoes, pork rinds, and other products that she needs for her business. 

Her dream is to keep up with her business and to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as green bananas, peanuts, meats, sausages, potatoes, and pork rinds.

loans.name: Rebelita

texts.en:
Rebelita G. is now 48 years old and married with three school-aged children. Rebelita is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 8,000 per month. 

Rebelita is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Rebelita has been growing corn for almost 15 years.

In the future, Rebelita hopes to have a plentiful harvest and earn a higher income. She hopes that someday she can start another kind of business and she dreams that their children will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a farmer from Nyamira town, in western Kenya, where he has been farming for 11 years. His mixed farm produces maize, beans, bananas and milk, which are all sold locally. He earns additional income from his business of selling cattle and jaggery (whole cane sugar) to the local market. His primary challenges in farming have been pests and diseases and inadequate farm implements to improve his production.

Samuel has requested for this loan of 45,000 Kes, through Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help in paying school fees for his three children and to improve the livelihood of his family. He plans to expand his coffee and banana plantation in the next 5 years to enable him to practice commercial farming.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal, de 52 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, tiene 7 hijos, el es comerciantes, se dedica a la venta de carne, lleva 20 años en el negocio. Cuando el empezó en esta actividad, fue con capital propio, antes el se dedicaba a trabajar en un taxi, el vio que no le generaba ganancia, entonces se dedico a vender productos plásticos como panas, platos, vasos, posteriormente se dedico a la venta de carne pues considera que este negocio genera mejores ganancias. En esta actividad su esposa lo ayuda a atender a los clientes.
Solicito el préstamo para capital de trabajo desea comprar carne pues no tiene suficiente  producto que ofrecer, necesita mas inventario de carne pues la demanda es mucha. Espera satisfacer la emanda de sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas, desea remodelar su carnicería, para tener mejores condiciones de infraestructura e higienes en su local.
texts.en:
Aníbal, 52 years old, lives in the city of Esteli. He has seven children. He is a businessman; he sells meat, and he has been in this business for 20 years. When he started this business, he started with his own money. Before that, he drove a taxi. He saw that it was not providing income, so then he sold plastic products such as pans, plates, and glasses. Later, he began selling meat, and he feels this business generates the most revenue. He wife helps him with this business by attending to the customers.

He is requesting this loan for working capital. He wants to have more products to offer; he needs more meat in his inventory because demand is high. He hopes to satisfy his customer demand and improve his sales. He wants to remodel his butcher shop so that he will have better infrastructure and a cleaner-looking place of business.

loans.use: to buy meat such as pork.

loans.name: Sabrina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sabrina lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ruth Iliana de 31 años quien tiene un kiosco el cual inicio con la venta de comida mexicana. Ella en la actualidad vende  gaseosa, chiverías y cigarro, además vende perfumes y cremas. 
El crédito invertirá en la compra de productos en cosméticos, perfume, cremas…etc. los cuales tiene muchos encargos.

Las otras integrantes de son Elena María propietaria de una pulpería y vende ropa, y Estela del Socorro  propietaria de un modesto comedor desde hace 17 años y vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Sabrina group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women.

Ruth Iliana, age 31, is one of them.  She has a kiosk, which she started by selling Mexican food.  Now she sells soft drinks, snacks, and cigars.  She also sells perfumes and creams.

She will use the loan to buy cosmetic products like perfume and cream, etc.  She has a lot of orders for them.

Another member is Elena María.  She has a grocery store and sells clothes.  The other member is Estela del Socorro.  She has had a modest eatery for 17 years, and she sells clothes.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Remedios requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Rosita has an eatery that serves various dishes. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making these dishes. 

Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making dishes

loans.name: Khyod

texts.fr:
Homme de 37ans, célibataire et père de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 7ans à 15ans, ayant quittée sa scolarité il se lance dans la vente des vivre frais en 2006. Son revenu journalier est de 25000 à 100000 frs par jour. 

Avec ce  prêt il  aimera agrandir son activité en achetant des vivres frais tels que des cartons de cuisse de poulet, des poissons de mer, des cartons de viande, des cartons de triple.

Sa stratégie est de faire des promotions de ses produits, avoir des prix abordable, avoir des meilleurs produits dans sa boucherie. 

Son ambition est d'aller acheter les produits à l'étranger et être grossiste des produits vivre frais car il pense beaucoup améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son entourage est content de lui car il se débrouille bien.
texts.en:
This man is 37 years old, single, and a father of two children aged 7 and 15. After leaving school, he started selling fresh foods in 2006. His daily income varies between 25,000 and 100,000 XOF.

With this loan, he would like to grow his business by buying fresh products such as boxes of chicken thighs, saltwater fish, meat and tripe.

His strategy is to promote his products, to have reasonable prices, and to have better products in his butcher shop.

His ambition is to go purchase products abroad and to become a wholesaler of fresh products, because he thinks a lot about improving his family's living conditions. His friends and family are happy with him because he is doing well.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken thighs and saltwater fish.

loans.name: Virgen De La O Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN D. LA O”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Yucay, en la Provincia D. Urubamba y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la señora Higidia; la socia es casada y tiene 57 años D. edad, la socia tiene 6 hijos; la socia trabaja en la agricultura y comercio minorista; la socia tiene un terreno en el cual produce maíz D. exportación, generalmente ella cuenta con sus clientes a los que directamente les venD. toda la producción D. maíz blanco D. primera, son granos grandes y dulces, la socia trabaja su terreno situado en Tarabamba, la socia tiene dos D. sus hijos independientes y los otros 4 aún dependen D. ella, la socia suele invertir la ganancia D. sus producto en los estudios D. sus hijos, en la compra D. víveres para el hogar y otros, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra D. semillas, abonos y el tractor que removerá la tierra para prepara la nueva siembra D. maíz. La socia solicita comprar semillas, pagara el tractor que preparara la tierra y comprar el abono para la nueva siembra D. maíz blanco.
La fotografia adjuntada  ala foto grupal pertenece a la socia Hortencia y se anexo al grupo poruqe ella tenía permiso D. llegar tarD. y al momento en el que ella se hizo precente ya 5 socios se habian retirado del grupo.


Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta D. maíz y productos secos, a la crianza D. animales menores, a la docencia.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen D. La O communal bank; the bank is located in the Yucay district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Higidia; she is 57 and married. She has 6 children. She works in agriculture and retail. She has a plot of land on which she produces corn for export. She generally has clients to whom she directly sells all of her white corn crop. White corn is a large, sweet grain. She works her land, which is located in Tarabamba. Two of her children are independent and the other 4 still depend on her. She usually invests her income from her crops in her children's studies, in the purchase of household supplies, and other items. She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and a tractor which will till the land to prepare for the new corn crop. She is requesting to purchase seeds, to pay for the tractor that prepares the land, and to purchase the fertilizer for the new crop of white corn.

The other members work in agriculture; sell corn and dry products; raise small animals; and teach.

The member is grateful for the support provided and also promises to be disciplined with the repayments of the quotas.

The small photograph is of Hortencia, who had permission to arrive late to the group meeting. At the moment that she came the other 5 members had already left.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pay for the tractor that prepares the land, and purchase the fertilizer for the new crop of white corn.

loans.name: Sop Seydina Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Seydina Mohamed est créé depuis le 14 décembre 2008, il regroupe 16 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

La présidente Diama est une femme de 47 ans, mariée, avec 02 enfants,02 nièces et sa mère malade en sa charge.

Elle tient une alimentation générale avec son frère. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Sur la photo elle est à droite habillée en boubou bleu rouge avec un châle orange sur les épaules et a levé la main gauche.

Elle voudrait avec son crédit renforcer son commerce pour gagner plus.

Elle a en sa charge les soins médicaux de sa mère et de son mari malades et elle soutient ses enfants dans leurs formations et scolarité.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called Sop Seydina Mohamed was created on December 14, 2008 and brings together 16 women who all come from the same neighborhood and whose principal activity is small-scale retailing. 

The president, Diama, is 47, married, and responsible for two children, two nieces and her ailing mother.  

She runs a grocery store together with her brother. She has good experience in this field. In the photo, she is on the right, dressed in a blue and red robe with an orange scarf over her shoulders and raising her left hand. 

She would like to use her loan to bolster her business so as to earn more. 

She is responsible for the medical treatment of her mother and her husband, who are both ill, and she pays for her children's training and school fees.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Roxana; tiene 30 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad;  La socia  tiene un automóvil el cual lo hace trabajar alquilando a un señor y el presta el servicio de taxi, la socia recibe diario el 70 5 del ingresos que trae el socio de ella y de este modo ella puede generar un ingreso extra a la casa, la socia también se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes,  y los cría y vende a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona, la socia también lleva  a Iscuchaka para la venta en la feria del pueblo, ella ahora requiere el préstamo para poder comprar 20 cuyes para aumentar sus galpón o criadero de cuyes, la socia con todos estos ingresos está ahorrando para terminar de construir su casa, ella desea poder dar a su hijo todas las comodidades y terminar de construir su casa y ahorrar para la universidad y los estudios de sus hijo. En cuanto a la crianza de cuyes desea poder seguir comprando más cuyes hasta incrementar el monto y hacer de esto un negocio rentable, crecer y distribuir en los diferentes restaurantes de la ciudad de Cusco, ella está mejorando la raza de sus cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 20 cuyes.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Roxana, 30, is a member of the “Solidaridad-Cachimayo” (Solidarity-Cachimayo) communal bank located in Cachimayo District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and one five-year-old son.  She has a car that she works leasing to a man who provides taxi services.  She gets daily 70% of the income her associate earns and this is a way for her to earn extra income for her home.  She also raises minor livestock like guinea pigs.  She raises them and then sells them to the various local restaurants.  She also goes to Iscuchaka to sell them at the town’s market.

She wants the loan now to buy 20 guinea pigs to expand her guinea pig nursery.  She is using income from all these activities to save up to finish building her house.  She wants to be able to give her son all the comforts and to finish building her house and save up for the university and for her son’s schooling.

With respect to the guinea pig raising, she hopes to continue buying more guinea pigs to increase her number and turn this into a profitable business; to grow and sell to various restaurants in the city of Cusco.  She’s improving the breed of her guinea pigs.  

She is requesting the loan to buy 20 guinea pigs.  She is grateful for the support she’ll get and she pledges to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy 20 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon Jairo es un microempresario que a sus 38 años de edad sueña con sacar a su esposa y su hijo adelante y brindarles un mejor futuro, trabaja todos los días comercializando los productos que su esposa fabrica, artesanías y detalles para fechas especiales, pues tienen buenos clientes y Jhon se encarga de comercializarlos por los pueblos aledaños a la ciudad de Medellín. 

Actualmente Jhon espera mejorar la capacidad de producción y comercialización para así generar mas ingresos que le permitan suplir las necesidades que su familia presenta, sin embargo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar el material de trabajo necesario para mejorar la producción y generar mas utilidades, motivo por el cual solicita un crédito que le ayude a aumentar sus ingresos y a que su negocio  progrese. Pues su sueño es llegar a tener un almacén que sea reconocido en el sector por su variedad de productos y el buen servicio, adicional a esto poder generar mas empleos, ayudando así a que otros puedan también cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jhon Jairo is a micro businessman who, at 38 years of age, dreams of getting his wife and son ahead in life and offering them a better future.  He works every day selling products that his wife makes: handicrafts and items for special occasions.  They have good customers and Jhon is in charge of selling the products in the neighboring villages around the city of Medellín.  

Jhon is currently hoping to improve their production and sales capacity so that they can make more income.  This will allow them to take care of their family's needs.  However, he does not have enough capital to buy the necessary work material to improve production and make more profit.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan which will help him to increase their income and enable them to make progress in their business.  Jhon's dream is to have a store which is well known in the area for the range of products that they sell and their good service.  In addition, he would like to be able to create more jobs which would help other people to fulfil their dreams too.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Dukundubuhinzi №3 A / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Philipe  fait partie du groupe Dukundubuhinzi No 3 A / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « ceux qui aiment à cultiver ». Il a 38 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 3 à 6 ans, dont 1 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  2 ans de secondaire.

Philipe est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz et utilisation des fertilisants. Dans les prochaines années, Philipe voudrait acheter d’autres champs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philipe belongs to the Dukundubuhinzi no. 3A/RSZ group. The name of this group means " those who like farming". He is 38 years old and married with two children, who are three and six years old respectively; one of them is at school. He himself has two years of secondary education.

Philipe is a rice farmer. This is his first loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

He plans to grow his business by selective sowing of rice seeds and using fertilizers. In the next few years, Philipe would like to buy other fields. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate and look after his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Narciso

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Homoine, provincia de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 3 ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 12ª classe e se formou como policial. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Boane quando decidiu engrenar na policia, é policia afecto no Comando Provincial ha mais de 24 anos e tem um salario de 8.633.33mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Já teve emprestimos em outros bancos (BIM) a longo prazo, e concluiu o pagamento sem dificuldade. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a obra da construção de uma capoeira (areia, cimento, pedra, barrotes, e outros.) para fazer a criacao de frangos.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a capoeira para ampliar a sua actividade comercial,  assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Narciso was born in Homoine District, Inhambane Province, southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of five children, three of whom still attend school. He completed grade 12 and trained as a police officer. He lives in his own home with his family, and supports his parents. He sends them money to help pay their household costs.

He left his hometown and came to Boane when he decided to join the police. He has been working in the provincial police department for more than 24 years. He has a salary of over 8,000 Mozambican Meticals per month. He uses this for household expenses, and saves some in his bank account.

He has already had long-term loans with other banks (BIM) in the past, and completed the payments without difficulty. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku, and is for the amount of 13,000 Mozambican Meticals. With the loan he will buy construction materials to build a chicken shed/coop (sand, cement, stones, planks/beams, and others) so that he can raise chickens. In the future he plans to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so he can complete the chicken coop and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a chicken shed/coop (sand, cement, stones, planks and others)

loans.name: Zyonnie

texts.en:
Zyonnie is a 30-year-old single woman. She lives in Mantic Tangub City. In order to help her family, Zyonnie owns and operates a general store in her town, where she sells a variety of products. She has been in this business for more than eight years. Each month, Zyonnie can earn PHP 8,000 from her business. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000, which she will use to purchase products to resell. 

Zyonnie has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year and this is her first loan cycle. In the future, she will use the profits she earns for her daily needs and to help her family. Also, she hopes that her business will continue to progress.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 21 años, es una mujer joven, amable y muy trabajadora. Vive con su pareja y que dentro de poco será madre, esta en estado de gestación de seis meses. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Rebeca consiste en la venta de ropa, desde hace dos años emprendió un negocio ella sola, tiene una tienda de ropa en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad, ahí a diario trabaja desde muy temprano, contrata a una persona para que le ayude en las actividades a realizar en el local. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es propio, no depende de nadie y lo que gana depende de su esfuerzo y sus ganas y deseos de superación. Sus ganancias son buenas ya que recupera su inversión y gana casi el 40% de lo que invierte. Tiene como plan ampliar su tienda de ropa. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en ser puntual con sus cuotas y pagar de manera puntual. Además esta muy contenta con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos se muestran como personas serias y muy responsables sin dejar de lado el compañerismo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más mercadería en ropa, ya que esta preparándose para entrar en la campaña navideña en los siguientes meses.
texts.en: Rebeca is a young woman of 21 years of age, kind and hardworking. She lives with her partner and will soon become a mother as she is 6 months pregnant. Together they live in their own house. Rebeca has been selling used clothes for the last 2 years. She started the business by herself and has a used clothing store in a busy city street. There, every day, she works from an early hour. She employs an assistant to help her with the work in the store. What she likes about the work is that its hers. She is dependent on nobody and what she earns depends on her effort, enthusiasm and desire to succeed. Her profits are good as she recovers her investment and makes almost 40% on what she invests. She plans on expanding her clothes store. This will be her 2nd loan with MFP and she hopes to have your continued collaboration so as to continue working on her objectives. On the other hand she agrees once again to be punctual with her repayments. In addition she is very happy with the group she belongs to as they appear to be serious and very responsible people yet friendly. With the requested amount, she will buy more clothing as she prepares to enter the Christmas season of the coming months.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Samuyu Group

texts.en:
N'bambeh is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. N'bambeh was born in Kasere village about sixty years ago. She is married to a teacher. The couple has nine children who no longer attend school. N'bambeh sells palm oil, sugar, tomatoes, etc.. She has been doing this for twenty years.

With the help of this loan, N'bambeh and her group will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and improve their living conditions. N'bambeh will use her share of the loan (800,000 SLL) to buy six gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: to buy six gallons of palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 40-year-old Lebanese married women living with her husband and two children, who are still attending school. She cooperates with her husband, who has been working in the Lebanese army for the past 20 years. 

Due to the increased demand for charcoal, she decided to open her own shop in 2010. She’s really happy to have a good number of customers so far. 

Today she’s asking to borrow $1,900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional charcoal for her shop in order to meet the big demand for this product in the Lebanese market. 

In the future, she plans to deliver charcoal to the neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal for her shop.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 34 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for her children. For the past 11 years, Emily has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells items such as sugar, soap, and other grocery items. 

Emily is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a married woman. She has a son who is 21 years old. She describes herself as strong and determined. She operates a clothes retail store. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of clothes. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes and to add stock of new shoes for sale. Beth's business goal is to own another clothes retail shop, near her estate, within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Melinda Aracely

texts.es: Melinda es una joven trabajadora de 22 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Puquina, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y también se dedica al cultivo de alfalfa y a la cría de ganado vacuno, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder alquilar un terreno agrícola sembrado con alfalfa para utilizar como alimento para su ganado. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Para alquilar un terreno agrícola sembrado con alfalfa para alimentar a su ganado vacuno

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a widow. She has six children. She and her children were settled in Khirdalan town.She is  internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan region. She has been selling the outdoor clothes: jackets, shoes,cardigans, dressing gown and etc. in the Khirdalan market for ten years. 
This 68-year-old woman supports to her family by herself. Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from the Komak Credit Union, she bought dressing gowns, jerseys, and pyjamas and etc.
She applies for a loan amount of $800 to buy the outdoor clothes.

loans.use: To buy the clothes

loans.name: Brenda Janeth

texts.en:
Brenda is a very dynamic woman. She is married and has two small children. The oldest child attends kindergarten and the younger one is about to start kindergarten. The income that her husband receives is not enough to cover all the family’s expenses and make the payments on their house. For this reason, Brenda started selling cosmetics so that she could help support her family. Now she needs your help. She wants to buy a stock of products in order to sell them and achieve a better income. She is seeking a loan of $250 to be able to do this.

Brenda and her family need your collaboration. It is in your hands to help this family. Don’t leave it for another day--today is your opportunity to help, decide to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Brenda es una mujer muy activa, es casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, el más grande de ellos asiste a la escuela preescolar y el pequeño esta a punto de entrar. El ingreso que recibe su esposo es muy poco para solventar todos los gastos familiares, además del pago que están haciendo para adquirir su casa, por esto Brenda inició con la venta de cosméticos, y de esta manera apoyar a su familia. Ahora ella necesita de tu ayuda, quiere surtirse de productos para poder venderlos y obtener un mejor ingreso, y solicita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares con este fin.

Brenda y su familia necesitan de tu colaboración, en tus manos esta el poder apoyar a esta familia, no lo dejes para otro día, hoy es tu oportunidad de ayudar, decídete.

loans.use: To buy a stock of products

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
Maria Isabel Martinez has been running her grocery store for more than 2 years now. She is very happy with her business because it has helped her carry on earning for her family. When her husband passed away, she and her daughter had to fend for themselves when they were overwhelmed with debt due to his death. Maria Isabel didn't know what to do. She spoke with her daughter and they decided to start a small business to help them get ahead. They are asking for a $1,200.00 loan to expand their business and buy more merchandise in order to improve revenue and so that Maria Isabel's daughter can finish college.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. Maria Isabel M. tiene mas de 2 años con su negocio de abarrotes ella esta muy contenta con su negocio porque la a sacado adelante en sus ingreso familiares cuando falleció su esposo se quedo desamparada ella y su hija de lo desesperada de todas las deudas que tenia por el fallecimiento de su esposo. No sabia que hacer platicando con su hija séles ocurrió poner un pequeño negocio el cual fue el que las saco adelante a las dos. Están pidiendo un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para ampliar el negocio y comprar mas mercancía y así estar mejor en los ingresos de ellas y que su hija termina una carrera universitaria

loans.use: Expand the business and buy merchandise

loans.name: Hemid

texts.en: Hemid S., his employee is pictured, owns and operates a small market in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Emid is looking for funding so that he can fill the shelves of his business with a greater quantity and variety of goods.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his store.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suarti

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Suarti has tried her hand at various kinds of business, in attempts to make sufficient money to help alleviate her husband's responsibility. But only the business of raising pigs has been a vocation that fits. By raising two piglets, Suarti can earn Rp. 250,000 per month. Every day Suarti is busy with raising the pigs in a very simple stable. Suarti business is growing, and this is not irrespective of Dinari's role, which has created the foundation for the business, including giving a loan of Rp. 1,400,000, used by Suarti to buy one sow which is ready to breed. Now Suarti no longer needs to buy piglits for raising, because Suarti can provide piglets for her neighbors. Many advantages are obtained by Mrs. Suarti from raising pigs, including earning enough to support her family, while the pig manure can be used as fertilizer in the vegetable garden.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Suarti sudah mencoba beberapa jenis usaha yang bisa mendatangkan keuntungan yang besar untuk membantu meringankan beban suaminya .Tetapi hanya usaha beternak babi yang merupakan usaha yang lebih menjanjikan. Dengan dua ekor babi yang di pelihara, Suarti dapat menghasilkan Rp. 250.000 per bulannya . Setiap harinya Suarti sibuk dengan mengurus ternak babi peliharaannya di sebuah kandang yang sangat sederhana . Usaha Suarti semakin berkembang , hal ini tak terlepas dari peranan Dinari yang ikut memberikan pembinaan tentang usaha disamping juga memberikan pinjaman modal Rp. 1.400.000.- , yang oleh Suarti di pergunakan untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi yang sudah siap untuk di kawinkan. Kini Suarti tak perlu lagi membeli bibit untuk di pelihara sendiri bahkan Suarti sudah bisa menyediakan bibit bagi tetangganya. Banyak manfaat yang di peroleh Bu Suarti dari beternak babi ,di samping hasilnya yang cukup untuk kebutuhan keluarga, kotoran babi bisa diolah menjadi pupuk kandang yang berguna untuk kebun sayurnya.

loans.use: To buy a breeding sow ready to birth piglets - Membeli induk babi yang sudah siap untuk dikawinkan sehingga segera memperoleh anak babi untuk dijual kembali

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng T. was married in 1988 and has 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter. In 2004 her mother taught her to weave silk, and she has been weaving ever since. She has also trained her younger sister, who lives with them, how to weave. Her husband runs a business repairing people's televisions. In addition, the family runs a business ploughing the fields of people in their community. Neither husband nor wife finished high school, but with their current business they are supporting all four children through school. 

Heng T. has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice before. She is now asking for a loan of $500, which she will use to purchase one more cow and expand the family's ploughing business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for her business

loans.name: Margarita Prensa

texts.en:
Margarita, 30, defines herself as an experienced businesswoman.  She runs a general store which people visit every day to get goods such as rice, vegetable oil, onion and ripe fruits.  She and her husband have four children, two boys and two twin girls. 

Currently, Margarita sells from her house.  Her dream is to have her own local area in which to operate her business.

With her $600 loan (the second one obtained from our organization), Margarita will keep her inventory well-stocked so she is able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To keep inventory well-stocked

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en: Raghida is a 35-year-old mother with one child. Raghida lives with her family in Aley. She makes bread, the kind that is called "saj." This is the fourth time Raghida has asked for a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary provisions to sustain her business. Raghida is actively participating in making a livelihood for her family.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Badirnisa

texts.en: Badirnisa M. is 39 years old and a mother of two children. She lives in Khudat, Azerbaijan. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy produce and fruit for resale.  Badirnisa has 7 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy produce and fruit for her market stall

loans.name: Karla F.

texts.es:
Karla Fernández is a 32-year-old divorcée who has been selling cosmetics for 3 years. After her divorce, she started her business in an effort to generate income for her two children, ages 4 and 2. She was also looking for an activity to occupy her time.

Because of her hard work and determination, her business is now prosperous with a sizeable clientele, which is why she needs a loan of $250.00 USD that she is willing to repay in 3 months. She will purchase merchandise with that loan because she has several orders that she cannot fill due to lack of capital. With your help, you will support Karla and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla Fernández es una mujer divorciada de 32 años que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, la cual inicio cuando se divorcio buscando un ingreso para sus 2 pequeños hijos de 4 y 2 años; además de una actividad para mantener su tiempo ocupado.

Debido a su empeño y excelente labor de venta actualmente su negocio ha prosperado y cuenta con una amplia clientela razón por la que requiere un crédito por US $250.00 y esta dispuesta a pagarlo en 3 meses para comprar mercancía, ya que tiene pedidos pero no cuenta con capital suficiente para surtirlos. Con tu ayuda apoyaras a Karla y sus pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Moli's Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
Moli is 34 years old and is divorced with 2 children, ages 13 and 7 years old. Moli has been selling fish since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.
