Aminata B., 51, is married and responsible for 2 children. Her business is serving cooked food. She wants to promote it. This business has permitted her to effect the construction of a restaurant.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintaining her business selling cooked food

loans.name: Mandir

texts.en:
Mandir L. is currently in the business of selling various items in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell in her shop. Mandir is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a carpenter. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a little restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more goods  to sell in her shop

loans.name: Atalia Elisa

texts.pt:
Atalia Elisa M. nasceu na cidade Maputo tem 35 anos de idade e é mãe de 5 filhos todos são estudantes, um dos quais tem dezoito anos de idade. Estudou ate 5 classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras.

Atalia vive com o seu marido na casa própria e sem ninguém mais sob sua responsabilidade. Teve toda sua infância na cidade na companhia dos seus pais e aos 16 anos de idade juntou se com o seu marido, com qual vive ate hoje.
Tem 6 anos de experiência no negocio de venda de bebidas e refrigerantes sem empregado e trabalha quase a tempo inteiro.

Vende mais cervejas de marca 2m que compra a 22,00MT cada caixa e vende a 300,00MT e consegue um rendimento semanal de 3.500,00MT e ate poupa 4.000,00MT pro mês.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e logo que ouviu falar da Hluvuku-Adsema, através das amigas, aproximou e solicitou este seu primeiro credito no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra do stock para satisfazer a demanda de produtos no seu estabelecimento convencional.

Espera pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para realizar o sonho de expandir o negocio e ampliar as instalações.
texts.en:
Atalia Elisa M. was born in Maputo, she is 35 years old and has 5 children, they are all studying, two of them are 18 years old. Atalia studied until the 5th grade but had to stop because of lack of financial resources. Atalia lives with her husband at their own house and they have no more responsibilities. She lived all her life in the city with her parents and when she was 16 she joined her husband and lives with him ever since. She has 6 years of experience in the business, selling drinks and snacks without any employees and works almost full time. Her best product is beer 2m that she buys at 22,00MT per box and sell at 300,00MT and gets an income of 3.500,00MT a week and saves up to 4.000,MT monthly. She never had credit with other institutions and after she heard about Hluvuku-Adsema from friends, she requested her first loan for 12.000,00MT to buy stock to satisfy the demand for products at her store. Atalia expects to pay the loan without any problem and be able to access other loans to fulfill her dream to expand her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy diverse products and snacks

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
M. Teddy is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a hard working businesswoman who has had a business selling matooke (plantain) from Katojo Cell for seven years. She is married with seven children and they are at the university and in secondary schools. Her business profits of 170,000/= a month give her a chance to pay their school fees.

Teddy ensures that she has good produce for sale and this gives her a chance to maximize her products depending on her stock and capital. She would like to make more profits as well as have a happy and healthy family.

Teddy needs a loan to be able to improve on her banana plantation by buying manure and fertilizer for a better output. She is grateful for the previous loans because they have helped so much in her business and family welfare.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer for her banana plantation

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia R. E. de 42 años de edad resid ene Colon municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Ana es madre soltera de dos niños Cristian de 13 años y Oscar de 10 años de edad, también vive con ellos la mare de Ana quien es la mano derecha y apoyo incondicional para Ana. Hace cuatro años Ana se decidió a montar su propio negocio y fue así como nació la sala de belleza que posee en la cual se prestas servicios profesionales es cosmetología y también se vende productos para el cuidado del cabello. Ana solicita un crédito para invertir en productos ya que poseen buena demanda y esto le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio con productos de belleza

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday sells drinks and foods in a restaurant, his wife help in him. He use his bus for commercials purpose. Sunday is 49 years old and married with 5 children. He hopes for the loan amount of N60000 to purchase more food stuffs for his business. He says thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff

loans.name: Doul

texts.en: Doul Y, 45, lives in the province of Pursat, Cambodia, where she owns and works a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught this by her grandfather. She is currently a good mother of six children, half of whom are married, with the others single and in school. She is married to Kham Ly, age 59, who helps her on the farm. In the past, Doul Y hired her nearby neighbor's buffalo to help plow her farmland during the farming season. She is currently hoping to reduce this cost; therefore, she would like a loan on Kiva in order to buy a pair of water buffalo.

loans.use: To buy a pair of water buffalo

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr: Kadidiatou Traoré est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et a la charge de ses 3 petits enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 7 ans et y a reçu 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Avec son crédit elle fabrique des jus naturels qu'elle conditionne dans des sachets en plastique et les vend devant les écoles ou dans des milieux où il y a un grand rassemblement. Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou Traoré is a 60-year-old married woman who has her three grand-children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for seven years and has received fourteen loans, which she has always repaid without difficulty.  With her current loan, she's making natural juices that she packages using plastic bags and sells in front of schools or where many people have gathered.  She helps her husband to meet day-to-day family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small business

loans.name: Mercedes Magali

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo, sus hijos y una hermana que tiene a su cargo en el sector Punto Cuatro, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de tres años maneja una pequeña botica en la casa en donde vive. Empezó vendiendo artículos de primeros auxilios y ahora ofrece diversas medicinas genéricas a sus vecinos. Ella nos cuenta que decidió instalar el negocio porque por la zona no había ninguno de ese tipo y tenían que ir hasta el pueblo para adquirirlos. 

Su esposo es trabajador eventual, se dedica ocasionalmente a la pesca o a la agricultura, con el esfuerzo de ambos pudieron comprar hace cuatro meses una máquina fotocopiadora con la que piensan ampliar su negocio.

Mercedes planea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más medicinas e implementarlo con la venta de artículos de oficina por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de sus objetivos.

Ella es una madre responsable y trabajadora, su negocio es conocido por la zona por lo que sus vecinos le tienen mucha estima. Su más grande anhelo es poder construir su propia casa  ya que actualmente vive en una vivienda alquilada.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 28 years old; she is married and has two children, aged 6 and 3. She lives with her husband, her children and a sister who is in her care, in the Punto Cuatro sector of Mochumí District, 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than three years, Mercedes has operated a small pharmacy in the house where she lives. She began by selling first aid supplies, and she now offers a range of generic medicines to her neighbors. She tells us that she decided to open this business because there had previously been no drugstore in the area, and people had to go into town to purchase supplies. Her husband is an occasional laborer who fills temporary jobs in fishing and agriculture. Thanks to both of their efforts, they were able to purchase a photocopier four months ago, which they intend to use to broaden their current business. Mercedes plans to expand her business by purchasing more medicines and selling office supplies. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Peruvian soles, which she will use to achieve her business objectives. Mercedes is a responsible and hardworking mother; her business is well-known in the area, and her neighbors have great respect for her. Her greatest desire is to be able to build her own home, since she currently lives in rented housing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing medicines to expand her business

loans.name: Croeb's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Croeb S. is the leader of a group of six members who all live in Boeng Satong village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Keo Nao, is a construction worker. The couple have five children; two are laborers and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: El señor Cesar A. trabaja como guardia de seguridad desde hace diecinueve años, un trabajo de dedicación para bríndale seguridad a otras personas, vive en un barrio de la capital en el cual se requiere de tener segura su vivienda para que no sufra de ningún robo, unas de su metas en terminar la construcción completa de su casa teniendo mejores condiciones de vida para su hogar. Con los bajos ingresos por su puesto se le ha hecho muy dificultoso construir su casa, mediante el financiamiento que le hemos brindado en el primer ciclo ha ido construyendo el muro de la parte trasera y con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cementos, hierros, piedras y continuar la construcción de la pared del lado izquierdo de la vivienda. Obteniendo mayor seguridad y protección para su familia, cumpliendo unas de sus metas, demostrando que es un hombre capaz de alcanzar las metas puestas para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar A. has been working as a security guard for nineteen years, dedicated to providing safety to other people. Cesar lives in a neighborhood of the capital where one needs to have a safe house to prevent robberies. One of his goals is to finish the construction of his house to improve the living conditions inside the home. The low wages from his job have made it very difficult to finish the house, but with the loan we granted him in the first cycle he has begun constructing the back wall. With this loan he will purchase construction materials such as cement, iron bars, and stones, and continue the construction with the left wall of the house. By improving security and protecting his family, Cesar will achieve one of his goals and demonstrate that he is a man capable of improving his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stone, sand, and cement to build a concrete wall for his house, in order to provide more security for his family.

loans.name: Manuel Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando N. de 35 años de edad, vive en una casa de caña con la facilidad de tener los servicios básicos de agua y luz, su casa esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Fernando comenzó como ayudante vendiendo cocos, ya que no le alcanzaba el sueldo decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de cocos, cuando nacieron sus dos hijas gemelas tenían mucha ropa que lavar y compraron una lavadora con esto mucha gente de su sector le pidió servicios de lavandería.

Ahora Fernando recorre en el triciclo por todo el sector vendiendo cocos desde las 08h00 hasta las 12h00, y la lavandería esta abierta desde las 13h30 hasta las 19h00 su esposa se encarga de atender la lavandería, una de las mayores dificultades son los ladrones, tienen cuatro hijos uno de 5 años, otro de 3 años, y dos gemelas de 4 años. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 200 cocos su carreta y 30 dejas para la lavandería, en el futuro quiere construir un local para expandir el negocio de la lavandería.
texts.en:
Fernando N. is 35 years old and lives in a reed house with basic water and electric services in the outskirts of Guayaquil, Ecaudor. Fernando started out as an assistant selling coconuts, but since he did not earn enough he decided to start his own business selling coconuts. When his twin daughters were born there were a lot of clothes to wash, so Fernando purchased a washing machine, and many people in the area began asking for him to provide laundry service. Now he rides his tricycle throughout the whole area selling coconuts from 8 a.m. to noon, and his laundromat is open from 1:30 to 7 p.m. His wife is in charge of the laundromat, and one of the biggest problems is theft. They have four children: a 5-year-old, the 4-year-old twins and a 3-year-old. With the loan, he wants to purchase 200 coconuts and 30 bags of "Deja" brand laundry detergent. In the future he wants to build a place where he can expand the laundromat.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coconuts

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 29-year-old married woman and the mother of two children, She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2006 to help her husband to support their household. 

Hala is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more textiles and tailoring tools to produce a greater variety of products for her clients.

loans.use: To buy more textiles and tailoring tools

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 45 años, es una mujer ejemplar que lucha sola por darles una adecuada calidad de vida sus 3 hijos. Actualmente vive con dos de ellos; Freddy de 23 y Flor de 11 años, su hijo mayor salió de casa en busca de un futuro mejor en la ciudad. 

Ser padre y madre para sus hijos es una difícil tarea que valerosamente afronta Juana desde que su pareja los abandonó. “Para llenar la olla” como ella dice, desde hace 20 años se dedica a siembra de papa, arveja y maíz, también cría ganado vacuno, dos asnos, algunas ovejas y cerdos. Al principio se confundían porque no sabía a quién atender primero, pero ahora las cosas han cambiado, sus hijos están grandes y le ayudan, pues a veces solo se dedica a preparar el almuerzo debido a las dolencias que le aquejan.
Juana se preocupa por tener sus chacras limpias para que sus hijos trabajen adecuadamente, además considera que su actividad es rentable por las satisfacciones y logros que le ha brindado en la vida.       

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y ha notado que su situación económica ha mejorado bastante; además le gusta ser parte de un banco comunal porque sus miembros son bastante activos y solidarios. Juana tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja, dos sacos de fertilizantes y dos botellas de insecticidas para sus cultivos de papa, los que podemos apreciar en la foto.
texts.en:
Juana, age 45, is an exemplary woman who has struggled alone to provide an adequate quality of life for her three children. She currently lives with two of them: Freddy, age 23, and Flor, age 11; her eldest son has left home in search of a better future in the city. Being both father and mother to her children is a difficult task which she has confronted bravely since her partner abandoned the family. "To fill the pot," as she says, she has worked for the past 20 years growing potatoes, peas and corn. She also raises livestock, including cattle, two donkeys, and some sheep and pigs. At the beginning, there was confusion because she did not know what to take care of first, but now things have changed; her children are big and they help her. At times, she only focuses on preparing lunch, due to the pains that affect her. Juana always ensures that her fields are well-maintained so that her children can work effectively. She considers her work to be worthwhile, due to the satisfaction and achievements it has provided her in life. This is Juana's sixth loan with MFP, and she has noticed that her economic situation has improved significantly. She also likes being part of a communal bank, because the members are quite active and show solidarity. Juana is planning to invest the funds she is requesting in a bag of pea seeds, two sacks of fertilizer, and two bottles of insecticide for her potato fields, which we can see in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 1, 3, & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria, 37, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Nuevo Renacer (Rebirth), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Maria is a single mother who lives with her two children in Samana, a small city in the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. Life in the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Maria runs a successful business selling home products to her friends and neighbors. With this loan, Maria will purchase sheet sets to sell to her friends and neighbors for a small profit.

This is Maria’s eighth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve her home life for her family. With her profits, Maria hopes to purchase a small van in order to make her business more mobile. This will add to her profits, which will allow her to improve life at home by finishing her bathroom and purchasing a computer for her children. Computers are difficult to afford, but are one of the best investments for a low-income household to make. It gives access to the world of information that those of us in the developed world take for granted while teaching children to use the invaluable tools of modern technology. In the long term, Maria hopes to have her own house one day, something of value she can pass on to her children.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Maria and the Nuevo Renacer group!

loans.use: To buy sheet sets for resale.

loans.name: Precella

texts.en:
Precella R. is from the village of Purok Makugihon, Gimangpang, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Precella is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Precella owns & operates a specialized retail business selling green bananas and dried fish in the local community. Precella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Precella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precella is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Precella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Badiha

texts.en: Badiha is a 44 year old married woman and mother of 3 young children. Since 1990, she has run a tailoring business from her home. She makes different products, in addition to repairing clothes. During this period, her work has increased and she needs to borrow $1,200 to purchase 2 sewing machines to be able to expand her work and to deliver her tailoring services more quickly to her clients. And with this loan, she is certain that her business productivity will increase and also her client base.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian G. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, married and has six adult children. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as cosmetics, lotions, etc. in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 30000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Vivian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 30-year-old married man who sells women’s clothes. He also earns extra income from sugarcane farming.

Victor is a member of Faulu Kenya and belongs to a group called JC Bravos whose members meet weekly to save their money. The members become guarantors in case a member defaults on a loan. In this way, Victor can easily access a loan from Faulu Kenya.

Victor has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more dresses to sell. He hopes to buy more stalls for selling clothes. He dreams of selling clothes wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy more dresses to sell

loans.name: Lealtad De Wilacota Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento LEALTAD D. WILACOTA se formo en la zona D. wilacota al sur D. la cudad D. La Paz, es una asociacion que inicia su primera secuencia D. credito. Esta compuesto por 9 socios integrantes habitantes en la misma zona. Muchos D. los integrantes D. la asociacion son jovenes que desean emprender con un negocio para poder ayudar con los gastos D. su familia.
                                                                                                                                                                     El banco D. Emprendimiento actualmente cuenta con una mesa directiva la cual a sido elegida D. manera popular y tambien por la responsabilidad D. las persona que lo componen. 

La Sra. Angela es la presidenta, vive actualmente en la zona D. ovejuyo con sus dos hijos ella es madre soltera por lo que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que tiene que ser Padre y Madre para ellos, la Sra. Angela venD. ropa para niños en distintas zonas D. la ciudad, vive con su madre quien cuida a sus niños mientras ella trabaja, trabaja todos los dias el dinero del prestamo lo utilizara en la compra D. ropa al por mayor y asi incrementar su capital D. trabajo y mejorar su negocio, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora con ganas D. superacion su deseo es comprar una casita a la larga y asi mejorar su calidad D. vida D. toda su familia.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y en muchos casos sacan a su familia adelante solas, desean mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion dle credito.
texts.en:
The Lealtad D. Wilacota Entrepreneurial Village Bank was formed in the Wilacota area to the south of the city of La Paz. They are in their first loan cycle. The group is maD. up of 9 members who live in the area. Many of them are young but hope to start a business to help with their household expenses. The bank currently has a board of directors which has been elected; the board members stood out for being very responsible. Angela is the group president and lives in the Ovejuyo area with her two children. She is a single mother who has to work hard to be both father and mother to her children. She sells children's clothing in various parts of the city. She lives with her mother who takes care of the children while Angela works everyday. She will use the loan to buy clothing wholesale to increase her working capital and improve her business. She is a very responsible, hard-working woman who hopes to move forward and someday buy a home and improve the standard of living of her whole family. All the group members are very responsible and in many cases, support their families on their own. They hope to better the standard of living of their families and they are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the support they are receiving through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa se dedica a la confección de Ropa para mujer (modista),  la mayoría de sus clientes son maestras de diferentes centros de estudios de esta ciudad, alumnos de los mismos y personas de otras oficinas gubernamentales y privadas, Rosa se ha sabido ganar la clientela por la especialidad con la que elabora las confecciones, además de dedicarse a la elaboración de ropa también arregla ropa que a las personas ya no le quedan o quieren hacer algún cambio en las mismas.
Rosa vivia en unión libre,  su compañero de hogar migro hacia los EE.UU. en busca de mejorar sus condiciones económicas, sus hijos que procreó con su compañero de hogar ya formaron sus propio hogares.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar telas, repuestos maquina de costurar, hilos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a seamstress; she makes women’s clothes. Most of her customers are teachers in various schools in the city, their students and employees of government and private offices. Rosa has won over customers with the special touches she puts into the items she makes; besides making new items she also provides alteration and repair services. Rosa has a common law partner but he emigrated to the United States to seek better economic opportunities; the children she had with him have all formed their own homes. She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread and sewing machine replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and sewing machine replacement parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bags and shoes

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es: Aldo, de 25 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elsa de 22 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. Los campos de cultivo, han sido en la vida de Aldo, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron que trabajando en la chacra nada le faltaría, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde siembra plátano y café. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad económica de su familia. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima. Con el tiempo espera seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Aldo, 25, is a cheerful and hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his wife Elsa, 22, and their 3 beloved children, to whom they wish to provide a better future. The fields that he cultivates have been, in the life of Aldo, an activity that has been necessary for survival; from the time that he was very small his parents always taught him that by working in the fields he would never lack for anything. For this reason, he decided to continue in his family's line of work, and now he has his own cultivations where he plants bananas and coffee. What he likes most about his work is to plant, because he knows that the economic tranquility of his family depends on this activity. He has been doing this work for 8 years, and what he considers most difficult is to care for his crops when there are abrupt changes in the weather. Over time he hopes to continue working hard and improving his crops. This is his 6th loan with MFP, and he knows that this support will be very beneficial to him in developing his business. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member, which is the reason that he is well respected. With the 800 Peruvian soles that he requests, he will buy more organic and chemical fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to care for his crops

loans.name: Zelaeh Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Zeleah. She is 43 years old, married and has four children who range from 16 to 25 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For five years, she has been selling rice and oil in Redlight Market, Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of rice and oil. She describes herself as respectful. 

Her goal is to expand her business, build a house, and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and oil

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Leng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eleven people are living I. Khvav village I. Takeo province and they all are made up a village bank loan. Mrs. Phalla L. is a village bank president who is 31-year-old, selected by the other members will use portion of their loan for different purposes. She is a Khmer noodle seller at her home and aside this she is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Now she has some problem because her field is far away from irrigation system and it is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Phalla L. is seeking for a loan to buy a pump machine and fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Sok Bam, is a chef and she has four children, three of whom are enrolled I. local public school, while the other is too small to work or study. All the members are shown I. the picture but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine and fertilizer

loans.name: Ainea

texts.en:
Ainea M. is a 38-year-old carpenter in Shinyalu town. He was married but later separated from his wife and 10-year-old son.

Ainea operates his business in Shinyalu market centre where he designs any kind of furniture his clientele requests, like beds, cabinets, tables etc. He has been in the carpentry business for the last six years and has been able to meet his expenses out of the profits he makes. 

He is taking his first loan from KADET Ltd and he intends to pay it well without default. He hopes to get a lender through KADET Ltd to enable him to expand the business by buying more timber, timber glue and nails. 

His dream is to expand his business and diversify to poultry farming because there is demand for poultry products in his area.

loans.use: To buy more timber for carpentry work.

loans.name: Koy

texts.en: Koy T., 34, is married and lives with his two young children in the Takeo province. He raises ducks and work as a farmer, earning $3 each day, while his wife sells chickens making $3 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Koy T. included. In light of these economic difficulties, he is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase cows to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow the farmland.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth N.  lives in Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. Ruth has a business of a ladies' salon. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Ruth also sells products at the shop, by means of wholesale. Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics and hair relaxers. The main business challenge(s) for Ruth include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for business are to own a bridal salon. She joined MCDT because she wanted additional business capital. Ruth lives in a rented home; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication expense(s).

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and cream hair relaxers.

loans.name: Nicaise

texts.fr:
Jeune Homme de 47 ans, marie et pere de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 25 ans.En 1985 , il perd son pere et arrete ses etudes ,a cause du manque de soutien, il se lance dans l'apprentissage de la maconnerie.
A la fin de sa formation, il cree sa petite manufacture de fabrique des buses, pavets,latrines, balustres ainsi que d'autres matriels de construction.
A l'octroi de ce pret il pense acheter une tonne de ciment,un camion de 8m3 de sable, un camion de 8m3 de caillasse pour construire 10 buses de 1000m3, 12 buses de 800m3 de 1m.

Il a pour ambition de devenir un grand entrepreneur de renomme hors frontiere , envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes et bonnes ecoles pour compenser ce que lui il n'a pas pu faire, et la fin ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Nicaise T. is a young man of 47 years, married and the father of 2 children whose ages range from 12 to 25. In 1985, he lost his father and stopped his studies because of the lack of financial support. He threw himself into masonry training. At the end of his training, he started his little manufacturing business, making concrete pipes, cobblestones, latrines and balusters [railing supports], as well as other building materials. When this loan is granted, he hopes to buy a metric ton of cement, a truck of 8 cubic meters of sand and another of 8 cubic meters of stones to build 10 concrete pipes 1000 cubic meters in size and 12 concrete pipes of 800 cubic meters by 1 meter. Mr. T. dreams of becoming a great businessman, well-known beyond Congo's borders; of sending his children to the best schools to make up for what he himself was not able to do; and finally of improving his family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a metric ton of cement, 8 cubic meters of stones, 8 cubic meters of sand

loans.name: Nora Helen

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en Km 5 vía Manta  encontramos el Banco Comunal Loma De Los Vientos, que se reúnen cada quince días, lugar de gente dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La señora Nora es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, y le ha gustado por los créditos,  además porque ha conocido mejor a sus vecinos y a otras personas. Tiene 34 años, y está casada hace 15 años, tiene tres hijos.   Su esposo es profesor en la Universidad de Portoviejo,  viven en una finca a la que cuidan.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de Esika y  Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería, y accesorios de damas),  trabaja tres a cuatro días a la semana,  sus productos los entrega ya que son bajo pedido y los fines de semana realiza los cobros. En la actualidad tiene  la idea de vender joyas de plata.

Es así como quiere invertir este nuevo crédito en comprar joyas de plata en diferentes tipos y modelos y espera salir adelante en esta nueva empresa.
 
Sus deseos son salir adelante en este nuevo negocio y por que no algún día comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas en otros lugares.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo at milemarker 5 on the road to Manta, the community bank "Loma de los Vientos" [Hill of the Winds] meets every fifteen days.  In this area, people work at agriculture and raising animals.

Nora is the founding member of the community bank, and has liked it because of the loans and because she has been able to get to know her neighbors and other people.  She is 34 years old, has been married for 15 years, and has three children.  Her husband is a professor at the University of Portoviejo.  They live on their own farm.

Nora works selling Esika and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes, and women's accessories).  She works three to four days a week.  She delivers items that are available on request, and on the weekends she collects her payment.  She is currently interested in selling silver jewelry.

She wants to invest this new loan in the purchase of different types of silver jewelry and hopes to move forward with this new undertaking.

Her dreams are to move forward with this new business and one day purchase a car to be able to make sales in other areas.

loans.use: Purchase silver jewelry

loans.name: Nyakiju Tukore A, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
Hard-working K. Naboth has, over the years, been operating a cattle fattening farm in Nyakiju cell, Rukungiri. He sells cows at the periodic markets that take place in Western Uganda. He purchases livestock directly, raises it on his farm and then finds a ready market for it supplying to butchers, hotels and other customers in the periodic markets. He also operates agricultural farms from which he generates income out of food crops like bananas, beans and maize.

The main drawbacks in his business have been unstable market prices and low capital input. With hard work and efficient customer care skills, he has managed to keep his business going for over 7 years. In a month, he makes profits to the tune of 400,000 Ugandan shillings.
 
His future plans are to expand his business transactions and to restock his farm. This will earn him more revenue to pay for his children’s education  and to improve their standard of living. With this loan, he anticipates great strides forward in achieving this dream and in restocking more cattle for sale.

loans.use: to restock his farm with cattle

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion P. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Visitacion owns a store selling fish such as sardines, mackerel and milkfish. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Visitacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Visitacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for working capital and purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic N.'s main source of income comes from providing repair services for watches for community members. She is 48 years old, married and has nine school-aged children. They are from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Marivic has been in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to provide her service. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed to provide service

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Mrs. Gemma B. is from the Barangay of Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.  She is 37 years old, married to Reneboy B. and blessed with 2 school aged children.  To make a living, she is presently doing work as a junk bottle cleaner and washer.  Her husband is engaged in scrap buying of metals, plastics and bottles.  She’s been engaged in this kind of labor for 5 years already.  She’s earning an average amount of not less than PHP 1,200 a month from this kind of work. 

In September 13, 2007, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities.  She has successfully repaid a loan amount of PHP 5,000.  

She is now requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 as her 5th loan which will be used as additional capital for her husband’s scrap buying business.  The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, loan repayments and her children’s education.  She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.  It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her husband's scrap buying business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora L. is from the village of Mahinog, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 60 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three adult children. To make a living, Aurora owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of fruits and green bananas in the local community. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Aurora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Aurora is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green bananas. This loan will be Aurora's sixth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green bananas

loans.name: Taleb

texts.ar:
طالب في عمر 28 سنة متزوج يعمل في بيع الخبز والكعك متجول ليس لديه محل يحب عمله لكنه يسعى دائما
الى تطويره فهو طموح يحب ان يزيد من مدخوله وتحسين وضع عائلته يحلم بان يكون لديه محل خاص به لبيع الخبز والكعك
له في عمله 5 سنوات له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة يعاني صعوبة في التوزيع لعدم وجود السيارة يريد من خلال طلب قرض
من المجموعة الى شراء فان خاص به لتوزيع الكعك والخبز ما يميزه هي الارادة والمثابرة والطموح الدائم في تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي
texts.en: Taleb, a married 28-year-old, has been working for the past five years as an itinerant street vendor selling bread and pastries. He is distinguished by his determination, persistence, and drive to improve his lot. Given that he enjoys a decent credit history with Al Majmoua, Taleb would now like to ask for a loan to purchase a van to facilitate distribution.

loans.use: To purchase van for pastry vending business

loans.name: Kouy

texts.en: Kouy K., 59, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She is a farmer, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her two children are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 42 on food and USD 10 on other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase rice to stock for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three young children. He has owned a car repair shop for 20 years. He is the only income source of the family. He has obtained three Kiva loans and he has been a very good client with punctual payments.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional equipment and tools to provide better services to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment and tools

loans.name: Ary's Group

texts.en:
The 12 people who form this village bank loan live in Preaek Run village in Kandal province. Mrs. Ary K., born in 1966, is the village bank president. She was selected for this position by the other members. She is a stay-at-home mother who prepares the family meals and maintains the household. 

Her husband, Mr. Sey Sopeap, born in 1967, works as truck driver. He earns a small income by transporting goods in his truck, which he owns. However, the truck is presently broken down and inoperable. To be able to finance the necessary repairs, Mrs. Ary K. is requesting a loan in order to fix the truck. 

This couple has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a truck driver, and one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to her husband's truck so that he may continue to support his family by transporting goods

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca se dedica a la venta de cosa de horno, ella siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, se siente muy satisfecha con este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy satisfecha por la ayuda que le brindan. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como maíz, bolsas, harina entre otros productos. Para el futuro le gustaría realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, pues siempre ha trabajado para mantenerse.
texts.en: Juana Francisca sells baked goods. She is always in search for a way to improve her income. She is very satisfied with her business. This is not the first time she requests a loan. She is very satisfied with the support these loans provide. The loan that she requests will be used to purchase goods such as corn, plastic bags, baking flour and other products. In the future she would like to make improvements to her house. She has always worked to support herself.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, está casado con la sra. Liz Gonzalez desde hace 2 años, tienen una hija juntos de 6 meses, viven en Villa Virgen del Carmen de la Ciudad Coronel Oviedo.
El Sr. Carlos es fotógrafo, realiza fotos y filmaciones de todo tipo de eventos, también realiza fotos tipo carnet al instante, se dedica a ese rubro desde hace más de veinte años pero hace cuatro años se independizó.
Es un trabajo que a él le gusta porque realza su creatividad, capta momentos felices que viven las personas, lo cual disfruta mucho.
Comenzó desde muy pequeño con un tío en Ciudad del Este. Aprendió bastante de esta profesión y al tener la oportunidad de obtener sus propias herramientas se independizó.
Comenta que para este rubro es muy importante la innovación, porque la tecnología es la base del éxito. Se acercó a la Fundación para solicitar apoyo y agradece la confianza que han puesto en su persona y en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32, has been married to Liz González for two years; they have a 6-month-old little girl.  They live in the city of Coronel Oviedo’s Villa Virgen del Carmen sector.

Carlos is a Photographer.  He takes pictures at and films all kinds of events.  He also takes instant I.D. card-type photos.  He’s been in this line of work for over 20 years but became independent at it four years ago.

This is work that he enjoys because it highlights his creativity; he captures happy moments in the lives of people which he enjoys doing very much.

He started while still very little with an uncle in Ciudad del Este.  He learned quite a bit about this profession and when he got the opportunity to acquire his own work tools he became independent.

He comments that innovation is very important in this line of work because technology is the basis for success.  He approached the Fundación to request support and he is grateful for the trust placed in him and in his work.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Mrs. SarO. was born in 1981.  She is married to Mr. Chhoeb, who is also pictured.  The couple has three children:  two study at the local public school, and the youngest one is 2 years old.

Mrs. SarO. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice.  She sells part of the rice, and with the rest of the harvest, she supports her family. She also sells Khmer cakes. Mrs. SarO. has had some problems with the rice field because the soil is infertille and the field is far away from irrigatiO..  To improve her rice productiO., Mrs. SarO. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband is a well digger who also earns some money to support the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Patrona

texts.en:
Patrona T. is from the city of Capucao Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Patrona is married with four adult-aged children. Patrona owns and operates a motor transportation service. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Patrona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Cerritos Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Cerritos" y esta ubicado en Morelos, México. La señora Angelina Sanchez B. es integrante del grupo tiene 45 años de edad, vive en union libre, tiene 2 hijos los cuales son su orgullo pues son muy estudiosos, ella es originaria de Morelos, se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace 8 años, y con el prestamo quiere invertir en los pedidos que le hacen sus vecinas amigas y familiares ya que aveces no le alcanza el dinero para cubrir sus pedidos. Actualmente ella es presidenta del grupo el cual esta conformado por 9 integrantes, se siente muy feliz ya que con su venta ayuda al ingreso familiar y asi mejorar su nivel de vida. Actualmente esta tomando un curso de decoracion de globos con lo cual planea tener asi otro ingreso pues podra ofrecer adornar en fiestas.
texts.en:
This group is called "Cerritos" and is located in Morelos, Mexico.  Angelina Sanchez B. is a member of the group.  She is 45 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are her pride and joy as they are very studious.  Angelina is from Morelos and she has been selling cosmetics for eight years.  She would like to invest her loan money in the orders that her neighbors, friends and family members make with her since sometimes she doesn't have enough money to cover their orders.

Angelina is currently the president of her group which has nine members.  She feels very happy because, through her sales, she is helping to make income for her family and thereby improving her family's quality of life.  Angelina is currently taking a course in decorating balloons which she hopes will become another source of income as she will be able to offer a service providing decorations for parties.

loans.use: to invest in cosmetics

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice K. is 43-year-old widow who supports two children. She is from the Gamalenya area and has a poultry business that she has been running for the past year.

Beatrice is applying for her first loan from Kiva field partner Kadet Ltd to enable her buy more chickens. Beatrice will use any additional profits made from her business to support her children.  In future, Beatrice hopes to see her business grow and wants to be able to take good care of her dependents.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her children are 7 and 2 years old. She has been running her hardware business for 1 year and has requested a loan for 60,000 KES to buy additional stock for her business. This includes more tiles, sinks, toilet basins, pipes, electrical equipment, etc.  

Jane has been a good client who repays her loan well. This is her 2nd loan with KADET. She plans to use her profits from her business to pay for her children’s education. In the future, she hopes to expand her small hardware business into a large hardware store where she will begin selling more items such as cement.

loans.use: buy additional stock for her hardware business

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta is 54 years of age and married with six children. Mareta owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling specialty goods & delicacies in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Mareta needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Mareta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mareta's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
For the past eight years, Fatuma has been selling juice from her home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she owns real estate houses which contributes another source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a cloth selling shop in the future.

Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

With this loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to repair her ceiling board, purchase plywood and timber, and pay for labor. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to repair her ceiling board, purchase plywood and timber, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 40, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Leonido, a security guard, and is the mother of one child. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josephine operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings which she sells to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her to continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns for use in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Josephine hopes to be able to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns for use in her business.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is a 37-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She is married and has six children between the ages of 1.5 years and 15 years old. Her husband is a teacher at secondary school, and all of her children are in school except the youngest one. Since 1997, she has owned a general store. This successful business has enabled her to save for her children and provide for the well-being of her family. Consolee will use this loan to purchase more items to sell in her store to meet the demand of her customers. She plans to continue to use the profits to provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Benkola 4 Group

texts.fr:
BENKOLA 4 est constitué de dix membres qui sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAÏMOUNA, au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70 000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola 4 Group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Maïmouna, sitting in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of around 70,000 CFA francs by the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Don Juan de profesion tecnico soldador, labora desde hace veintiun años, pues es negocio propio, el cual aprendio en sus trabajos anteriores.
Hoy en dia tambien vende vehiculos cuando le sale la oportunidad, ganandose ese dinero extra,  es padre de cinco hijos los dos mayores trabajan y su esposa trabaja en servicios domesticos.
Lo que desea hacer don Carlos con este nuevo financiamiento es las divisiones de los cuartos, ya que tiene esta necesidad, para lograr privacidad con su familia. siendo Afodenic, el que ha hecho posible esta mejoras a su vivivenda
Para esto comprara: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro y poder, hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Don Juan has worked as a professional welder for 21 years. He has his own business and learned this trade while working in his previous jobs. Today he also sells vehicles whenever the opportunity arises in order to earn some extra money. He is the father of five children, two of whom are adults and working. His wife works in domestic services.

Don Juan Carlos needs this new loan so that he can put up room dividers in order for his family to have privacy. AFODENIC has made it possible for him to make these improvements to his home. He plans to buy blocks, sand, and iron, as well as pay for labor to complete the work.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor for installing room dividers so that his family can have privacy.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.en:
Cristian is a member of  "The Endeavour" Communal Bank located in the Traiguén neighborhood in the city of Temuco. He has been working as a street vendor for 7 years, selling a variety of products from his car outside of a store. He says that during this time his sales have been very good and he now has a large number of dedicated clients.  Cristian also always gives credit to some of his most responsible, and also elderly clients, allowing them to make payments on the goods that they would like to purchase.  

Cristian works from 8am to 5pm Monday through Saturday and eats his lunch while working.  He prefers to purchase the majority of his merchandise from distributors located in the capital city of Santiago.  He did comment that while he prefers to buy in Santiago he incurs more costs to pay for transportation and custody of the products.

Cristian will use the loan to buy new merchandise with the goal of changing some of his current products and restocking; he would also like to start selling some natural remedies. Sales in Traiguén are slower, so he would also like to find a place to sell in the center of Temuco. 

Cristian is single and lives with his mother, two brothers and a niece. Their dreams are to travel abroad to experience other cultures and landscapes. He is very happy and grateful for the assistance provided by Fondo Esperanza; he enjoys sharing experiences with other people and has learned new things to help his business.  
 
Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucanía, located 670 km south of Santiago. There are a number of lakes (Pucón, Villarrica) located nearby Temuco, as well as parks filled with striking fauna and flora. Half of the Mapuche indigenous population also lives in this region.

loans.use: to purchase and restock merchandise

loans.name: Vilma Yaneth

texts.es: Vilma. D. 42 años D. edad y tiene 3 hijos ella se dedica a la venta D. productos comestibles D. primera nececidad,desD. hace varios años,ella tiene su tienda y en ella venD. frijol,Arroz,jabon,golocinas,etc ella nos cuenta que gracias A Dios le ha Ido bien en su negocio,y esta solicitnaod este credito para la compra D. productos comestibles D. primera nececidad,el sueño D. ella es agrandar mas su negocio y tener mas variedad en su tienda para satisfacer a sus clientes y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old and has three children. For many years she has sold basic grocery products. She has a shop where she sells beans, rice, soap, candy, etc. 

She says that thanks to God, her business does well. Vilma is asking for this loan to buy basic grocery products. Her dream is to grow her business and offer more variety in her store for her customers, and wants to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery products.

loans.name: Irma Susana

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “Medallitas de Oro II”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, estudió solo la primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales vacunos y ovinos.  La señora cuenta que también trabaja en la mina de Camana extrayendo oro.
Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,200.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de maquinarias, comprensora para perforar en la mina y obtener más oro,  trabaja junto con su esposo en la mina y su mamá le ayuda con los animales.
Su sueño es tener más maquinas para trabajar y extraer más oro.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la conversación y la distracción entre las socias.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the “Medallitas de Oro II” community bank, which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  She only completed her primary education.

Irma has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business buying and selling cows and sheep.  Irma tells us that she also works in the mine in Camana, extracting gold.

Irma is requesting a new loan for 1,200 soles which she will invest in buying machinery: a compressor for drilling in the mine and extracting more gold.  She works with her husband in the mind and her mom helps her with the animals.

Irma's dream is to have more machinery for working and extracting more gold.  What she likes about her community bank are the conversations and the fun that she has with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy a compressor (machinery)

loans.name: Dédévi Ahoefa

texts.fr:
Dédévi  Ahoefa est une femme  âgé(e) de 33ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 02 enfants.
Dédévi  Ahoefa travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux depuis 1995 après achat au GHANA et BENIN. 
Dédévi  Ahoefa a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des colliers, des boucliers, des bracelets et autres.  
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut aider son conjoint dans les charges du ménage et voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Dédévi Ahoefa is a 33-year-old woman.  She is married to a driver and has two children.  She has been working as a jewelry retailer since 1995.  She buys her goods in Ghana and Benin.

Dédévi Ahoefa has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy necklaces, earrings, bracelets and other items of jewelry.  She says that she uses her profits to help her husband with their household expenses.  She would like to see her children grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is 54 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are still studying. To make a living, Rudy owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for 23 years and earns approximately 80,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Rudy is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Dalmacia

texts.en: Dalmacia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has a furniture business. She and her husband design tables and chairs made of bamboo. They sell their products at their town's market. Dalmacia has requested a loan to purchase more bamboo, nails and varnish. She hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo, nails and varnish.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive por la comunidad de Racar en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la artesanía como es la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Rosa tiene 37 años, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 20, 18, 16, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad, tres de sus hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, una de sus hijas pasa en casa y ayuda en los quehaceres, su penúltimo hijo se encuentra estudiando en el colegio y su ultima hija está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra fuera del país ha migrado para que con su trabajo mejorar la economía de su hogar, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa hace poco tiempo empezó a trabajar en una panadería y labora todo el día  de domingo a jueves.
 
Se encuentra reingresando en el banco comunal ya que anteriormente era socia. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para el pago de una letra de su máquina de coser y en la compra de tela ya que va a poner con un pequeño taller de costuras en su casa.
 
Su meta es crecer y mejorar el su negocio que va iniciar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Futuro para un Bienestar Communal Bank.  She lives in the neighborhood of Racar in Cuenca.  This area has beautiful landscapes and its people make traditional crafts, such as tile and bricks.  Many of them live in the city doing different kinds of work, but they maintain the culture and tradition of their parents.

Rosa is 37 years old, married, and has six children who are 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, and 10 years old.  Three of her children work and help with the household expenses.  One of her daughters stays at home and helps with chores.  Her second-to-youngest son is in school and her youngest daughter goes to a small school in the city.  Her husband lives out of the country, having moved so that he could make more money for his family with his work.  They own their home.

A little while ago, Rosa started working in a bakery and she works all day from Sunday to Thursday.

She is rejoining the communal bank, as she used to be a member.  She is going to use the loan money to make a payment on her sewing machine and to buy fabric, as she's going to set up a small sewing workshop in her home.

Her goal is to grow and improve the business she's starting.

loans.use: to buy fabric and make a payment on her sewing machine.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is a 58-year-old woman, married with four children.  She sells fruits and vegetables.  Roza has many years of experience in this business.  She works everyday with the help of her husband. 

Roza is a member of AqroInvest.  She requested a loan of 1200 AZN.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to improve business.

loans.name: Kyenjojo Twekembe Womens Group

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Godfrey has been working hard at his tea farming business in Kyenjojo for five years. Godfrey has been gaining successes in this business with his enterprising nature and unfailing diligence. He sells most of his tea to the many tea producing factories in Kyenjojo and other towns in Western Uganda.

Godfrey is happily married with four good-natured children. Three of his kids are in school and doing well.

Week in and week out, Godfrey says his sales returns total 30,000 Ugandan shillings. His hope is that once he puts his loan proceeds into good and efficient use, his business's prospects will see a new lease on life. Godfrey wants all the best for his family and business and he says he will go to every length, not only to improve on their current circumstances, but also to ensure that they both will enjoy a good and prosperous future. On the side, Godfrey also runs a commercial transportation business.

Godfrey says he will use this loan to purchase high grade manure to improve his tea farms.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure to improve his tea farms.

loans.name: Hagurukamuhinzi/cyrkr Group

texts.fr:
Jean Baptiste  fait partie du groupe Hagurukamuhinzi/Cyrkr. Il a 33 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 2 à 12 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Baptiste est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Baptiste voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Jean Baptiste belongs to the Hagurukamuhinzi/Cyrkr group.  He is 33 years old and is married with four children ranging from two to 12 years old.  Two are in school.  He has six years of elementary education. Jean Baptiste grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer. His strategy to grow his business is to use selected rice seedlings.  In the coming years, Jean Baptiste would like to be the rice supplier in his region.  With the profits, he plans to raise his children and provide schooling for them.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Sènana Marie

texts.fr: Sènana Marie est âgée de 53 ans et est mariée à un certain Louis. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sènana Marie et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Sènana Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Sènana Marie mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année, la transformation. De façon secondaire, Sènana Marie vend des céréales, du charbon de bois et divers autres articles dans sa région. Sènana Marie s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Sènana Marie  sollicite un quatrième crédit. Sènana Marie a bien remboursé les trois premiers crédits reçus de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sènana Marie is 53 years old and married to Louis. The couple are raising their 4 children, all of whom attend school, and they both contribute to the household expenses.

Sènana Marie did not go to school. In order to be able to take care of her needs and those of her family, she has been working in the processing industry for around 15 years. She also has a sideline business selling cereals, charcoal and various other products to local customers. She gets her supplies in Benin.

Sènana Marie is requesting a 4th loan in order to restock on supplies, so that she can better respond to customer demand and increase her level of business. She has fully repaid her 3 previous loans from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacs of corn, bags of charcoal and assorted items for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is single and has four children. Esi sells gari, which she has done for 10 years. Esi uses her income to support her husband to clothe and feed their children.
