Esi will use the loan to purchase bags of gari to sell. With the new profits from her business, Esi plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari to sell

loans.name: Acuario Group

texts.es:
Acuario esta integrada por un grupo de mujeres que se han impuesto emprender sus propios negocios.
Cada una de ellas con aspiraciones y deseos de sobresalir, se encontraron en un mismo empleo, a raíz de esto, han descubierto que tienen una fortaleza para poder iniciar sus propios negocios.
Ariana, es madre de dos hijos y esta decidida a darles una mejor educación y calidad de vida de la que ella ha vivido.
Se ha motivado para iniciar la venta de zapatos y es por eso, que hoy toma el crédito para poder invertir en mercancía y así iniciar su negocio.
Ariana esta convencida que esta es una buena decisión.
texts.en:
Acuario comprises a group of women who have decided to set up their own businesses. With their own individual aspirations and hopes for success, the women found themselves working in the same job. It was from there they realised that they have the strength to start their own businesses. 

Ariana is a mother of two children. She is determined to give her children a better education and quality of life than she had herself. This has motivated her to start selling shoes and so she is asking for a loan in order to invest in stock and get her business going. Ariana is sure that this is a good decision.

loans.use: to invest in shoe stock.

loans.name: Los Zensontles Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras Perla tiene 43 años de edad, casada con un hijo y se dedica a vender cosméticos desde hace 6 años. Los cosméticos son de la Avon quienes los vende al crédito y al contado a vecinos, amigos de la comunidad lo que le a permitido sacar a su familia adelante, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como crema para cuerpo, crema
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial members. Perla is 43 years old and married, with a son. She has made a living selling cosmetics for six years. The cosmetics are from Avon. She sells them on credit and in cash to neighbors and friends of the community, which has allowed her and her family to come out ahead. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics like body creams and creams.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of Avon cosmetics like body creams, face creams, colognes, perfumes, women's lotions, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Nel is 18 years old and is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology. He is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Nel (student and the person in the picture) is a son of Lilia (member of NWTF). He needs 6,000 PHP to pay his tuition fees for the first semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

When he graduates, Nel plans be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Marta es una mujer con una edad de 30 años, quien estudio su primaria pero no termino ya que no tenía apoyo económico por sus padres quienes son de escasos recursos cursando hasta el cuarto grado. Ella se casó a sus 18 años tiene 3 hijos pero actual mente ella es madre soltera por razones personales. Sus tres hijos, una hembra de 7 añitos lo cual con esfuerzo está estudiando el tercer grado y dos varones uno tiene 5 años y está en preparatoria y el tercero no estudia ya que esta pequeño de edad. Ella les brinda lo necesario para salir adelante, por lo cual tomo la decisión de dedicarse a la siembra y cultivo de café llevando a cabo esta actividad por 9 años de forma propia. El terreno donde tiene su cultivo de café está ubicado a una distancia aproximada de una hora y media caminando ya que no cuenta con un medio de transporte para desplazarse. El Sueño de Marta, que su propiedad y sus cultivos de café provean lo necesario y sean rentables, que el precio del café se mantenga estable y no baje para poder dar a cada uno de sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y la oportunidad de estudiar aprovechando a si mismo las ganancias de cada cosecha y poder seguir ampliando su propiedad para salir adelante. Maria solicita crédito para la compra de fertilizante, pago de mano de obra para asistir y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que quiere sembrar 2 manzanas más.

loans.use: para compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para asistir sus cultivos de café

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон трудолюбивый парень из района Хамадони. Ему 25 лет. Абдурахмон работает учителем в университете города Душанбе. Ему нравиться его работа. Но параллельно с работой Абдурахмон еще и учится на 5 курсе в университете. Ему остался последний год. Поэтому чтобы оплатить за учебу он обратилась к Вам за поддержкой. Абдурахмон очень надеется, что Ваша помощь поможет ему с достоинством окончить университет и получить долгожданный диплом специалиста.

loans.use: На оплаты за обучения.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
My name is Eva L. and I have been selling cosmetics, creams, hairpins, sodas, perfumes, shampoo, conditioner, and hair gel in my store for the past two years. This activity allows me to provide food for my daughter. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales and provide better products to my customers, using the profits to buy windows and shelves but most importantly provide food for my newborn daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Eva L. me dedico a la venta de cosmeticos, cremas, ganchos, colas, perfumes, shampoo, acondionador, aritos, gelatina para pelo, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, actividad que me genera ingresos para el alimento de mi hija, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mejores ventas y mejores productos en mi tienda, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar vitrinas y estantes y lo mas primordial darle el alimento a mi hija recien nacida.

loans.use: Buy nail polish, shampoo, conditioner, hair gel, hairpins,  sodas, lipsticks, colas, sunglasses, creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.en: I have been working making and selling tortillas for several years, and everyone in my area knows me as Doña Coco. My neighbors and other people who like my tortillas are my clients. With the revenue from my sales I have been able to help my children receive an education and pay for the household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of water, flour, firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire more stock for her potato selling business

loans.name: Nazirjon

texts.en:
Nazirjon H. is married and has two small children. His family lives with his parents who are very old and on pensions. Nazirjon is a hairdresser, but because his income is very small, he also has this business. His wife works at home looking after their children and also selling different food products from a room that Nazirjon made into a shop.

Every day, Nazirjon goes to bazaars in different kishlaks to trade. Afterwards, he comes home, rests, and cuts his neighbors' hair. All of this work forms his family income. He spent his first loan to expand the assortment of perfumery and small goods. As his business has grown and is comparatively big, he needs money for its expansion. He has applied for a loan to increase his business.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Mr. Vasif is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 46, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Vasif owns a herd of cattle.  Each morning he grazes his herd and then sells beef in the local market of Saatli town.  He uses some of his profit margin to buy calves to breed.  The income from the four cows he has is too low to support his family, and that is why Vasif decided to increase his number of cattle to increase his income and to provide for all the necessities of his family. 

For this purpose he has applied to the Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy four calves.  In the Caucasus region the price of one calf is about $100.  In half a year Vasif can sell one breeded cow for $500.

loans.use: To purchase 4 calves to increase his business

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan is a 54 year-old married man and lives with his wife. Owing to forces beyond their control, his wife is constantly traveling. Juan also lives with one of his daughters, who is independent and married. Juan dedicates himself to the repair of all types of vehicles. He has years of experience in his line of work. He doesn't have much competition, owing to the well known high quality of his work and the large demand of his clients. The price of each repair varies according to the type of job he does. Juan has had three credit loans in the past with this institution. All have been paid off without problems. This is his fourth loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

JUAN ES UN SEÑOR CASADO DE 54 AÑOS DE EDAD. VIVE CON SU ESPOSA QUIEN ESTA CONSTANTEMENTE DE VIAJE POR MOTIVOS DE FUERZA MAYOR, TAMBIEN VIVE CON UNA DE SUS HIJAS QUIEN ES INDEPENDIENTE Y CASADA. JUAN SE DEDICA A LA CHAPERIA DE TODO TIPO DE VEHÍCULOS, TIENE VARIOS AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. NO TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA PORQUE DEBIDO A LA CALIDAD DE TRABAJO QUE REALIZA ES MUY CONOCIDO Y TIENE BASTANTE DEMANDA DE CLIENTELA. EL PRECIO DE CADA CHAPERIA DE AUTO VARIA DE ACUERDO AL TRABAJO QUE SE REALIZA. TUVO ANTERIORMENTE TRES CREDITOS CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION QUE HAN SIDO CANCELADOS SIN PROBLEMAS, AHORA ES SU CUARTO CREDITO.

loans.use: The construction of a platform in his home

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en:
Roziya R. lives in Khujand, Tajikistan; she is married and has 4 children. She has a clothing shop in the Panjshanbe bazaar where she sells women's, men's, and children's clothing. Roziya R. has a variety of clothing, and repeat customers, but she wants to import the new fashions demanded by the population today.

Roziya R. has been a dependable client of MicroInvest since 2006. She now requests a loan of 2000 TJS (about $600) to increase the variety of clothing that she offers for sale.

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Thol and her husband have been married since 2003. They have two children, one son and one daughter. Both of her children are still young and stay at home. Thol and her family live in a fertile farming area along the Tonle Bassac (river), a tributary of the Mekong, several kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She sells meatballs, boiled eggs and other kinds of food. She started her business at the beginning of 2007. Besides selling food she also grows banana for selling. Her husband is a driver for a company.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time for the amount of $400. She will use this money to buy chairs and tables to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables for selling meatballs, boiled eggs and other kinds of food

loans.name: Otih

texts.en: Otih, 33, is married to U., who works as a laborer and earns a very small income. To cover their living expenses and support their two children, Otih opened a grocery store at her house and earns $5 a day. She is asking for a loan of $75 to add to her business capital. She is a member of MBK and she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Looking for a way to support her husband and provide the best to her 3 young children, Patricia T. started to work with her sister 7 years ago. She started selling used clothes to later acquire a bulk of clothing to start her own business.

She currently needs $300 USD to purchase merchandise since her sales are increasing. She will repay this loan over the course of 3 months. Lets support Paty so she can reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia T. buscando apoyar a su esposo y brindarle a sus 3 pequeños hijos lo mejor, hace 7 años empezó a trabajar con su hermana vendiendo ropa usada para posteriormente adquirir una paca e iniciar su negocio.

Actualmente necesita US $ 300 para comprar mercancía ya que ahora sus ventas se están incrementando, este crédito lo pagara en 3 meses. Apoyemos a Paty para que vea realizadas sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jema

texts.en: Jema is a married woman with 2 children, ages 22 and 18 years old. Jema owns a small shop. She started in 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $9 from her sales. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Kim-Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Kim-Oeun C. and his wife Mrs. Kim ROEUNG have been married since 1985 and have five children: four sons and a daughter. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Kim-Oeun learnt to repair radios, TVs and tape recorders after he got married, and started his own repair business in 1986. His wife earns additional income for the family, selling Chinese noodles and coffee at their house. With the combined income from their businesses, the couple is able to send all of their children to school.

Mr. Kim-Oeun is now requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase more tools and spare parts so that he can expand his radio, TV, and tape recorder repair business.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for repairing TVs, Radios, and Tape recorders

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr:
Matar K. is a young craftsman living in the district HERSENT DE THIES. He is married and has two children. His business consists of making camp-beds that he sells at the local market and to tourists. With this loan, he would like to buy raw materials to make beds in bulk before the rainy season.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Matar K. est un jeune artisan vivant au quartier HERSENT DE THIES .il est marié et père de deux enfants . son activité consiste à confectionner des lits de campagne qu'il revend sur le marché local et aux touristes .avec ce pret il veut acheter des matières premières pour fabriquer des lits en quantité avant l'arrivée de l'hivernage .

loans.use: To produce camp-beds

loans.name: Atina

texts.en:
Atina I., 35, is married with 1 child. She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the local community and relatives and also to shops arround town 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Atina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also support her child at school and make her church contribution. Her husband is always engaged in operating the business.

loans.use: Purchase a new overlock sewing machine, thread, and Elei printing materials

loans.name: María Santosa

texts.es:
Maria lives with her 10 children, her husband left her when she was younger and she had to figure it out on her own for all of them. Since she has been alone, Maria has been working on different activities to support her 10 children, the situation was not easy back then, but now thanks to the hard work, she acquired a truck, which she uses to provide freight services. Making a good use of her time, she also sells second hand clothing on Sundays and Mondays, the rest of the week she works with her truck.

Maria has always liked working, the only difficulty that she finds in selling second hand clothing is transporting the merchandise and set it up properly. Maria has always worked for the wellbeing of the children, although they are older now, she wants to give as much as she can to them. With the money from the loan, she will buy more clothing to generate more income and in the near future be able to purchase another truck to expand her freight business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

María vive con sus 10 hijos, su esposo la abandonó cuando era más joven y tuvo que encargarse sola de todos ellos. Desde que se quedó sola María ha venido trabajando duramente en diferentes actividades para sostener a sus 10 hijos, la situación no era fácil en ese entonces, pero hoy gracias a su arduo esfuerzo, pudo adquirir un camión, el cual lo emplea en brindar servicio de carga, aprovechando el tiempo, también se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano los domingos y lunes, el resto de días trabaja en su camión.

A ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar, la única dificultad que encuentra en la venta de ropa de segunda mano, es tener que trasladar la mercadería y acomodarla debidamente. María siempre ha trabajado por el bienestar de sus hijos, aunque ahora están más grandes ella desea brindarles lo mejor hasta que las fuerzas se lo permitan. Con el dinero que se le facilite, comprará más ropa de segunda mano para generar más ganancias y en un futuro cercano poder comprarse otro camioncito para poder expandir su empresa de servicio de carga.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell, and use the profit to purchase a truck for freight services

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
La señora Crecencia, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia del Dorado y distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de chupetes y ya tiene buen tiempo en esta actividad. Aprovecha el tipo de clima de la zona para ofertar sus productos, cuenta con una congeladora que le permite almacenar buena cantidad de chupetes por que tiene un personal que vende en las escuelas de su distrito.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 04 meses comprará insumos para la preparación de sus chupetes como: azúcar en saco, bolsitas y vasitos para chupetes, colorantes y frutas para la elaboración de sus chupetes, además quiere comprar calaminas, clavos en kilos para calamina,  fierros y palos para techo. Desea mejorar su casa para darle una mejor seguridad a sus cosas.

Crecencia tiene 50 años de edad, 8 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes. Ahora vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en algunas actividades. Ella es una persona amable y trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su meta es tener una bodega en su casa para solventar sus gastos y tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Señora Crecencia, member of the community bank "Doradinas en Accion", lives in the region San Martín, in the province of Dorado, in the district of San José de Sisa. She is dedicated to selling popsicles and is now having a good time with this activity. She takes advantage of the type of climate of the region to offer her products. She works with a freezer that allows her to keep a good quantity of popsicles, which is why she can sell them in the school districts. With the loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in four months, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her popsicles like: sugar, little bags and little cups for popsicles, food colorings, and fruits, for the production of her popsicles, and she also wants to buy corrugated iron, nails for corrugated iron, iron and poles for her roof. She wants to improve her house and make these things more secure. Crecencia is 50 years old, has eight children, who are already independent. Now she lives with her husband, who supports her in some of the activities. She is a friendly and hard working person with strong desires to move forward in life. Her goal is to have store in her house, to settle her finances, and to have a peaceful old age.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients like sugar, little bags and little cups, food coloring, and fruits.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor S., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is married and has 3 children. Despite the fact that she never received a quality education, she has worked hard over the years and has therefore acquired invaluable business skills in the process.

Gulbahor operates her own business whereby she trades materials at the local bazaar. Further, she states that she purchases her materials directly from suppliers, and she proudly notes that she has earned a good reputation as an honest trader. In addition, she explains that she has many loyal/repeat customers, as well as a wide assortment of materials for sale. At present, Gulbahor is seeking a business development loan through KIVA in the amount of 2,800 STJ ($825) over 4 months to expand her product line by importing new materials.

loans.use: To further diversify her expanding business' product line by importing additional materials

loans.name: Mrs. Kong Sarim's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 12 people living in Damnak Trayueng Village in Takeo Province and is led by Mrs. Kong S., who owns 0.5-hectare upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Since this field is currently infertile, Kong is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to revitalize the land. Her husband, Mr. Tuon Sokha, is a motorbike taxi driver with a small income that helps support the family.

Mrs. Kong S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school. Mrs. Horng L. is presented in the picture, substituting for her husband.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her rice field more productive.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina, a member of the Gratitud Village Bank, is 43 years old and lives with her husband and their four children. Sabina sells prepared meals from a mobile cart on a street near the Grau Lot Market, working from 6 a.m. until late at night, often assisted by her daughters.  Sabina is now requesting a loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar. Her dreams are to improve her business and to have her own home.  
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Loek

texts.en:
Loek V. is 41 years old. She is a rice farmer who also makes cakes to sell in her village to her neighbors. She started the business in 1987 and can earn an income of approximately $2.00 per day. She is a mother of three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband, Tem Sarith, is 45 years old and makes a living growing rice and is also a local chef for wedding parties or other ceremonies.The family lives in Pursat Province.

To begin a new business and enlarge an exiting business, V. would like to ask for a loan in part to buy equipment to make sugar cane juice for sale and in part to order ingredients to make cake to sell.

loans.use: To buy equipment to make sugar cane juice to sell.

loans.name: Iyekeorentin

texts.en: Iyekeorentin O. is 38 years old and she is married with 4 children. Iyekeorentin lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells notebooks and kitchen utensils. She has lots of customers and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs Kiva loan assistance to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more notebooks and kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more notebooks and household products to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica K. is a 47 year old woman. She is divorced and the mother of four children. Currently, her eldest daughter is a qualified nurse; one has completed senior high school and is waiting for his test results and the others are in school. Monica lives with her family in Abofour. She is a food vendor who sells rice and stew in the community school where she lives. She started her operation about twenty years ago. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business.

Monica is asking for a loan of $750  to buy more meat, vegetables, bags of rice and firewood to produce in larger quantities which will increase her efficiency . She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support and provide for her family and finance her children's education. Monica belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Nti, which means "Because of God".

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Esperanza Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres con Esperanza”, or Women with Hope, is a group of fifteen entrepreneurs seeking additional loan funds from Esperanza International.  The group’s prior loan has been successfully repaid and the group hopes to use additional loan funds for further business expansion.  MarieL. is one of the coordinators for this group in Santiago.

MarieL., mother of two and proud grandmother of three grandchildren (ages: 13, 6, 3), lives with her husband and sells beauty products.  With funds from her prior loans from Esperanza, MarieL. has been able to establish a loyal customer base and her customers are able to buy her beauty products on credit and pay for their purchases at the end of the month.  This agreement allows for a flexible payment system and has been very successful for MarieL..  MarieL. plans to use her next loan to purchase additional beauty supplies to increase her inventory.  MarieL. dreams of a “beautiful house” and plans on using her profits towards that goal.  

Other members of MarieL.’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including ice cream, clothing and perfume sales, as well as small restaurants.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase Beauty Supplies to Sell to Customers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, tuvo 3 hijos con su primera pareja, quien murió. Ahora tiene 2 con su actual compromiso. La artesanía es una de las habilidades que heredó de sus padres; cuando vivía su primer esposo ella preparaba los hilos para que él pueda tejer con mayor rapidez. Ahora con su pareja actual, ambos tejen, Rosa se levanta a las 3.00am para avanzar con sus tejidos y apartir de las 5.30am se dedica a su otro negocio, que es un restaurante que abrió hace 3 meses, al que aún no se acostumbra, ya que lo más le gusta es tejer, pero la necesidad económica les obligó a buscar nuevas fuentes de ingreso, debido a que la artesanía es muy rentable en ciertas temporadas, pero para cubrir los meses donde la demanda baja decidieron empezar a vender comida.  Y es justamente en el mes próximo de abril, en semana santa, cuando sus artesanías les dejan muy buenas ganancias. Rosa es la presidenta de su banco comunal, en este cargo dice sentirse muy bien, y está demostrando ser una cliente muy responsable, tanto en los pagos de sus cuotas con el sus funciones dentro de su grupo. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP. El dinero que está solicitando lo derivará a la compra de materiales para su artesanía, asimismo comprará un saco de arroz y un balde de aceite para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and has had 3 children with her first husband, who has passed away. Now she is responsible for 2 of the children. Craftmenship is one of the abilities that she got from her parents. When she lived with her first husband,, she prepared the threads so that he could weave with the best speed. Now with her partner, both make textiles. Rosa wakes up at 3am in order to make her textiles and at 5:30am, she works at her other business, a restaurant that she opened 3 months ago. She isn't used to running the restaurant, and what she likes best is to make textiles. However, economic necessity obligates her to make new sources of income, since craftsmanship is only profitable at certain times. To cover the months of low demand, she started selling food. It is just next month, the month of April during Holy Week, that craftsmen make the best earnings. Rosa is the president of her communal bank, in this she is doing well, and she is proving to be a very responsible member with her payments and her functions in the group. This is her third loan with MFP (field partner.) The money that she is asking for will be used for buying materials for her craftsmenship, a bag of rice and a bucket of oil for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materiales for making blankets and supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum M., 46, and her husband, Mr. Phally Sok, 46, live along the Tonle Basac River (a tributary of the nearby Mekong) about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1981 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. The eldest son is a driver for a company and two children are in school.

Sum and her husband have been growing and selling jasmine flowers for nine years. They also buy some jasmine from her village for resale at a market in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of US $800 repair her motorbike and to purchase flowers on contract for resale.

loans.use: Motorbike repair and to purchase flowers for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Ali has been working as a mason since 2006. He requested a loan of US $500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his business, as well as his financiA. situation. Ali is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, Ali didn’t have start up capitA.. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To buy construction tools

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores II ubicado en Jaillihuaya del  distrito de Chuchito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 47 años de edad, y 3 hijos.  De estado civil conviviente, posee estudios de primaria completa, Vive en la Urbanización Aziruni 3ra etapa, Maz-C4  Lte 6.
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela R. desde hace casi 1 año e inicio su negocio de venta de artesanías gracias a su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles.
En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir  en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus artesanías (lanas de diferentes colores),  ella vende sus productos en las feria de la región,
Su mayor sueño, es hacer de su negocio una pequeña empresa, para así poder obtener más ganancias.
A ella le gustan mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y la forma de pago.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to Las Flores II Communal Bank, located in Jaillihuaya in the Chuchito District (Puno Province, Puno Department). She is 47 years old and has three children. She lives with her significant other and completed an elementary school education. She lives in the third phase of a development called Aziruni, Maz-C4, Lot 6. She has worked with the Manuela R. movement for almost a year, and she started selling handicrafts with the help of her first loan for S/. 300.00. At this time she needs a loan for S/. 800.00 to invest in the purchase of bulk material (different colors of wool) to make those handicrafts. She sells them at local fairs. Her greatest dream is to turn her business into a small company so that she can earn higher profits. She likes the Communal Bank meetings and the payment terms very much.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different colors of wool

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is 31 years old and she is married, She has been a food items seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She belongs to Tukubalianae group loan (Group code 2009). She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items  for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. sells cosmetics such as body spray, powder, pomade, cream, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She hawks and treks to other markets to sell as well.

Agnes is 40 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children--one son and three daughters who are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana.

Agnes has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. Keji is 30 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Keji hopes to be able to build a charcoal store and buy a motorbike About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela  es socia del Bancomunal  San Luís 
Mariela  es conviviente tiene 47 años, tiene tres hijos de 25, 20 y 15 años, este ultimo esta en la escuela estatal. 
Mariela ella es ama de casa, pero por necesidad tuvo que trabajar empezó a tejer y hacer bordados en cojines, les da a una amiga  que tiene su tienda en Villa el Salvador.
Desde que Mariela esta en Finca aprendió a ser  mas responsable en los pagos que se le da.
Mariela necesita un préstamo de  800 soles, para la compra telas e hijos al por mayor en gamarra.
Mariela tiene un sueño de tener su propia tienda de bazar.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the San Luis Village Bank. Mariela is 47 years old, married and has three children of ages 25, 20 and 15 years old. The last child is in public school. Mariela is a house wife, but because of necessity has also worked sewing and making borders for cushions, which she then gives to a friend who has a store in Villa el Salvador. Since Mariela started working with Finca, she has learned to be more responsible with her payments and invoices. Mariela needs a loan of 800 soles for the purchase of fabric and other supplies at wholesale prices in Gamarra. Mariela's dream is to someday have her own market business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale fabrics

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie A. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Annalie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Annalie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not her only means of generating revenue, selling a variety of "viands" in the local community is Annalie's primary source of income. Annalie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Annalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annalie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Phorp Norng Group Loan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorp N. is a group leader of five who all live in the village of Daeum Rumdael in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Gnuoy Se, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still make only a small income to support the family. Now Mrs. Phorp N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets and pig food. She will use the rest of money to buy zinc for her house.

All the people in this group loan are asking for end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Piglets, pig food, and home repair

loans.name: Cumbe (Ceunca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Cumbe está situado en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, su clima es frío,  este lugar se caracteriza por sus llanuras donde la mayor parte de sus habitantes se dedican a  la agricultura, ganadería y a la elaboración de productos lácteos como: quesos, mantequilla, yogurt etc.

Las socias del Banco Comunal Cumbe  viven en la parroquia San Antonio, casi todas se conocen desde que eran niñas,  ellas  son muy buenas amigas y siempre  un grupo muy alegre y unido que están dispuestas a trabajar juntas para conseguir  una mejor calidad de vida para ellas y sus  familias.  Aquí algunos historias de las socias del Banco.

La señora Gloria Isabel León T.,  es una socia muy colaboradora del Banco Comunal Cumbe, ella vive en la comunidad San Antonio en la parroquia Cumbe, tiene 31 años de edad es casada y fruto de su amor procreo dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en la construcción profesión que le permite ayudar económicamente a su familia, la casa en la que habitan es arrendada.

Gloria es comerciante  de ganado vacuno, porcino, ovino, los  compra y revende el mismo día o los  lleva a su casa para cuidarlos y criarlos un poco mas y venderlos a la siguiente semana; en esta actividad lleva cuatro años y nos comenta que  le va muy bien,  además se dedica  a la crianza de  cuyes y pollos.

Gloria  tiene una buena relación de amistad con sus compañeras de grupo, lleva cinco años trabajando junto a la fundación y nos comenta que con los préstamos recibidos  ha podido estabilizarse económicamente. 

Con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entrega va a invertir en la construcción de un criadero de pollos.

Su gran sueño es llegar a tener su propia vivienda para comodidad y  tranquilad de toda su familia.

La señora María Mercedes M. L. es socia activa del Banco Comunal Cumbe, vive en la parroquia Cumbe comunidad San Antonio, tiene 40 años de edad, concibió cinco hijos de 23, 22, 18, 16, 14 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos los tuvo en unión libre pero se separó de su pareja, ahora tiene un nuevo compromiso y debido a eso su padre optó por llevarlos a vivir con él a la ciudad de Quito,  sus hijos no vienen a visitarla y tampoco ella ha podido ir a verlos por su actual esposo, su hijo de 18 años trabaja como ayudante en un camión, su hija de 16 estudia en el colegio Miguel Cervantes en Cumbe y su ultima hija estudia en la ciudad de Cuenca en el colegio Marianitas.

Nos comenta que al inicio la situación con su actual esposo no era buena porque le maltrataba mucho y era muy malo, pero tuvo un cambio muy positivo cuando migró al extranjero, estando solo a la distancia empezó a valorar a la familia, hace un año regresó y es otra persona,  más cariñoso y hogareño, viven en casa propia.

María se dedica a la agricultura,  lo que produce vende en las ferias y tiene  para su propio consumo, además posee una vaca la cual le proporciona leche para entregar a sus clientes, también  tiene una tienda de víveres hace diez años, nos comenta que le va muy bien porque tiene su clientela fija.

María lleva diez años en su banco comunal y comenta que los prestamos le han beneficiado mucho porque le han permitido terminar su casa y también para implementar su tienda.

Con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería surtida para abastecer  su tienda y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su  meta es  llegar a tener un gran galpón de pollos.

La señora María Luzmila T. G. es una socia carismática del Banco Comunal Cumbe, ella vive en la parroquia Cumbe comunidad San Antonio,  tiene 49  años de edad, enviudó hace quince años, se pone muy triste al contarnos que su esposo fue asesinado por su amigo sin saber hasta ahora sus motivos, fruto de su amor conyugal procreó seis hijos, los mayores ya son casados,  actualmente vive con su hijo de 20 años que trabaja para ayudarla con los gastos del hogar,  su hija de quince  que es madre soltera de un niño de un año nueve meses,  habitan en una casita vieja de adobe pero  de su propiedad.

María se  dedica a la agricultura,  siembra papas,  hortalizas, etc.  para el consumo en su hogar y si la producción es buena  saca  una parte a la venta en los mercados,  también cría pollos, cuyes  y tiene una vaca lechera entregando lo que produce  a los carros lecheros que pasan por el campo. Se levanta muy temprano pues debe distribuir su tiempo  en el campo,  el cuidado  de su hogar y de su nieto.

Dentro del banco comunal se llevan muy bien entre todas las socias ya que  a mas de ser muy amigas son familiares, María lleva siete  años haciendo préstamos en la FUNDACION ESPOIR, se siente muy  agradecida por la ayudada recibida porque le ha permitido estabilizarse un poco económicamente.

El  préstamo obtenido de la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos,  alimento y vitaminas para incrementar su negocio, así como para mejorar los recursos económicos de su hogar.


Su sueño es llegar a remodelar su casa por que esta en  mal estado.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Cumbe," is located on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. Its climate is cold. This area is characterized by plains where the majority of its inhabitants make a living through agriculture, livestock, and producing dairy products such as cheeses, butter, yogurt, etc.

The members of the Cumbe communal bank live in the parish of San Antonio. Almost all of them have known each other since they were girls. They are very good friends, and this is always a very happy and united group. They are willing to work together to achieve a better quality of life for themselves and their families. Following are some stories of the members of the bank.

Señora Gloria Isabel León T. is a very contributing member of the Cumbe communal bank. She lives in the community of San Antonio in the Cumbe parish. She is 31, married, and has 2 children. Her husband works in construction, which allows him to help his family economically. The house they live in is rented.

Gloria sells cows, pigs, and sheep. She buys them and and resells them the same day or takes them to her home to care for them and raise them a little more and then sells them the following week. She has done this for 4 years, and she tells us that it is going very well. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens.

Gloria has a good friendship with the other members of the group. She has worked with the foundation for 5 years. She tells us that with the loans she has received, she has been able to stabilize herself economically.

With this loan that Fundación Espoir is offering her, she is going to invest in the construction of a chicken house. Her biggest dream is to have her own home for the comfort and tranquility of her whole family.

Señora María Mercedes M. L. is an active member of the Cumbe communal bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish in the community of San Antonio. She is 40 and has 5 children, who are 23, 22, 18, 16, and 14. She had her two oldest children with a man with whom she used to live, but they separated. Now she has a new relationship, and because of this, their father chose to take them to live with him in the city of Quito. Her children don't come to visit her, and she hasn't been able to go visit them because of her current husband. Her 18-year-old son works as an assistant on a truck. Her 16-year-old daughter studies in the Miguel Cervantes school in Cumbe, and her youngest daughter studies in the Marianitas school in the city of Cuenca.

She tells us that at first, the situation with her current husband wasn't good because he treated her badly, and he was very bad. But he changed for the better when he traveled out of the country to work. Being away made him start to value his family. It's been a year since he returned, and he is a different person. He is very caring and stays at home. They live in their own home.

María works in agriculture. She sells what she produces in the markets and has enough for their own consumption. She also owns a cow that provides her with milk for her customers. She has also had a supplies store for 10 years. She tells us that it is going very well because she has a fixed clientele.

María has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years. She tells us that her loans have benefitted her a lot because they have allowed her to finish building her home and to start her store.

With this loan from Fundación Espoir, she is going to invest in the purchase of assorted merchandise to supply her store and to offer better service to her customers. Her goal is to have large shed for chickens.

Señora María Luzmila T. G. is a charismatic member of the Cumbe communal bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish in the community of San Antonio. She is 49 and has been a widow for 15 years. She became very sad when she told us that her husband was murdered by his friend and she still doesn't know his motive. She has six children, and the oldest ones are married. She currently lives with her 20-year-old son, who works to help her with their home's expenses. Her 15-year-old daugther is a single mother of a 9-month-old boy. They live in a little old adobe house, but it is their own.

María works in agriculture and produces papas, vegetables, etc., to consume in their home. If the production is good, they sell part of it in the markets. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs and has a dairy cow. She sells what it produces to the dairy trucks that pass through the countryside. She gets up very eary because she has to distribute her time between the fields and caring for her home and her grandson.

Within the communal bank, the members get along very well. Besides being good friends, they are family. María has recieved loans from Fundación Espoir for 7 years. She is very thankful for the help she has received because it has let her stabilize herself a little economically.

She will invest the loan from the foundation in the purchase of more chickens, feed, and vitamines to grow her business. In this way, she will improve the economic resources of her home. Her dream is to remodel her home because it is in bad shape.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a chicken house, to purchase animals, feed, vitamins, and merchandise for a store

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Through her membership in ASHI Teresita Maluco is requesting for a much larger amount of loan which will be used to support her desire of growing her hog fattening (pig raising) business. Her two children whose age range is from 25 and 26, are still dependent to her financially since they were only high school graduates. Opportunity of getting better and well compensated job for them is hard though. During the times wherein they are studying, it was so hard for Teresita to provide their needs at the same time providing also he needs of her business with such a very small amount of capital. A profit she makes out of this business is her family’s main source of income since her husband’s livelihood being a laborer is sporadic since then and now. Depending on it alone, there could have been no food on their table as regular as it should be, and her two children could not have graduated from high school.  However, for Teresita it is never too late yet to keep on dreaming for her children. Loan she requests now is her opportunity of achieving it. Once she had made her business grow, she could be of great help to her children and can as well provide her children source of income. The entire family can be working in the business to make it successful provided they have sufficient capital through loan.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for the variety store's inventory.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La  señora Rosa P. Macías  es socia activa del Banco Comunal 24 de Septiembre en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí, ella tiene  siente años de casada y  dos niños aun pequeños.

Rosa  junto a su esposo tienen  una panadería en el cantón Tosagua, por algunos años trabajaron  en Portoviejo pero  hace un año decidieron regresarse a Tosagua porque ya tienen su fiel clientela,  el  esposo de nuestra socia es el encargado de administrar y repartir el pan en bicicleta a las tiendas de su comunidad mientras que Rosa se dedica a la elaboración del producto.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación  van a comprar los insumos necesarios para la elaboración del pan como  mantequilla, harina, latones para hornear,  huevos, etc.  Así como para incrementar otras variedades de pan de sal y de dulce y para mejorar la producción que tienen a la fecha de  300 panes al día y llegar a mas clientes. 

El sueño de  Rosa es poder montar un mini-market  con todo lo necesario en productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar,fideos, granos, artículos de limpieza y aseo personal para su distinguida clientela en la ciudad de Portoviejo.
texts.en:
Rosa P. Macías is an active member of the “24th of September” Community Bank in the city of Portoviejo in Manabí province. She has been married for seven years and has two young children.

Rosa and her husband have a bakery in Tosagua county. For several years they worked in Portoviejo, but last year decided to return to Tosagua because they already had a loyal clientele there. Rosa's husband is in charge of the administration of the business and delivers the bread by bicycle to shops in their community. Rosa is responsible for making their products.

They will use the funds from this loan to purchase bread-making supplies, including butter, flour, eggs, baking pans, etc. In that way, they will be able to produce other varieties of sweet and savory breads to increase their output (which is currently 300 loaves of bread daily) and serve more customers.

Rosa's dream is to have a mini-market selling all household necessities, including first aid supplies, rice, sugar, pasta, grains, cleaning products, and personal hygiene items, for her distinguished clientele in Portoviejo.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread-making supplies, including butter, flour, eggs, and baking pans

loans.name: Khan Mohammad

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is K. Mohammad. He lives in Jalalabad. He is married with six children. He is the only one at home that is responsible for paying the house expenses.

He is a farmer and has been involved in this business for more than 15 years. He is very experienced in the field of farming. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani to buy more seeds and the required tools for farming.

He really wants to progress and advance his business. He is confident that with the loan he will be able to work in a better way and support all his family members.

Finally, he would like to extend his gratitude to the Kiva lenders that support the entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for his farming

loans.name: Nonvissidé

texts.fr: A. Nonvissidé est née en 1980 à Adja au Mono au Bénin. C’est une célibataire qui réside depuis huit ans au quartier Zounga à Abomey Calavi, non loin de Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Nonvissidé n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Nonvissidé s’est mise à vendre depuis 8 ans déjà, des tissus et également des chaussures à Cococodji et à Pahou, non loin de Cotonou. Nonvissidé s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Nonvissidé a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Afin d’agrandir davantage son activité et de faire face à la forte demande de la clientèle surtout en ces périodes de fêtes, Nonvissidé sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Nonvissidé ambitionne louer une boutique pour faire écouler ses tissus.
texts.en:
A. Nonvissidé was born in 1980 in Adja in Mono, in Benin.  She is unmarried and has been residing for eight years in the Zounga district in Abomey Calavi, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Nonvissidé never attended school.  In order to support herself, she got started selling cloth and also shoes eight years ago in Cococodji and in Pahou, not far from Cotonou.  She stocks up from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She once obtained an ALIDé loan, which she has repaid.  To expand her business further and to cope with the strong customer demand, especially during these holidays, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  Her ambition is to lease a shop to sell off her fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of cloth and some shoes to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
la sra Adela M. se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, compra los panes a diferentes productores y los vende en su tienda, este pan se le vende muy rapido todos los dias porque tiene muy buen sabor y es bajo en su precio, todo el pan que compra se vende en el mismo dia, tiene muchos clientes.
estando ahi nosotros con ella nos regalo una bandeja de pastelitos de piña y si saben muy bien.
Adela desea el credito para poder invertirlo en mas pan, ya que a veces se queda corta con las ventas y el producto se le termina rapido.
nos comento que esta muy feliz porque su negocio esta creciendo cada vez mas. su meta es poder construir una area de atencion a sus clientes que sea mas grande y tener varios estantes en donde guardar el pan para poder darles una mejor atencion a sus clientes y que su producto este bien ordenado y guardado.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela M. sells sweet bread, which she buys from different producers to offer in her store. This type of bread sells very quickly every day because it tastes good and is inexpensive. Adela has many customers and all the bread she buys is sold on the same day. When we came to see her, she gave us a tray of miniature pineapple cakes which were very good.

Adela wants a loan so that she can invest in more bread. Sometimes her sales end abruptly because her product sells quickly. She says she is happy because her business is growing even more. Her goal is to build a service area for her customers that is larger and has several shelves on which to display the bread. This will allow her to provide better service to her customers and keep her products secure and well-organized.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweet bread

loans.name: Brenda Irene

texts.es: La señora Brenda Irene esta casada con el señor Gustavo quien labora para una empresa de electricidad y ella es supervisora de cuartos en un hotel de hospedaje, ellos anteriormente tenían un crédito con nosotros, lo terminaron de pagar siempre con puntualidad, se verifico que realizaron su mejora, y ahora están tramitando este crédito para la colocación de vitropiso en su hogar y la colocación de un portón en el frente de su vivienda para mayor protección de sus hijos que aun están pequeños y del hogar.
texts.en:
Brenda Irene is married to Gustavo who works for an electricity business and she is a room supervisor in a hotel, they previously had a loan with us, which they always paid on time, their improvements have been verified, and now they are applying for this loan to lay tiles in their home and to put a door in the front of their house for greater protection of their children who are still young and at home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Placing of door and tiles in their home

loans.name: Hojalatería Group

texts.es:
El grupo Hojalateria está integrados por tres mujeres que trabajan haciendo sartenes ellas son Ruth F. L., María del Carmen F. y Marcia Marbelly G.. Ellas llevan doce siclos de trabajar con adim es decir unos tres años en los cuales su negocio ha ido mejorando notablemente.

La señora Ruth L. empezó con la producción y ventas de sartenes pero para diversificar las fuentes de ingresó en otros rubros como la venta de ropa en el cual le a ido muy bien.  Su compañera María del Carmen F.  está casada con un agricultor quien para ayudarla vendió una ternera con lo cual ella inicio con su negocio de sartenes y su pequeña venta.

Mientras Marcia Marbelly G. de 22 años inicio a la edad de 12 años a producir sartenes y a vender chiverías, ya que desde muy joven trabajo con su madre en este oficio actualmente ella es independiente.
texts.en:
The Hojalatería Group ("plumber") is composed of three women who produce frying pans: Ruth F. L., María del Carmen F. and Marcia Marbelly G.. Over the past three years they took out twelve loans from the microfinance institution ADIM, which resulted in a marked improvement of their business.

Ruth L. began producing and selling frying pans, but she wanted to diversify her sources of income and added the sale of clothes to her activities, which proved to be a very good decision.

Her group partner María del Carmen F. is married to a farmer who sold a calf to help her. María used the money to start her business selling frying pans and other small items.

Marcia Marbelly G., now 22, began at the age of 12 to produce frying pans and sell yogurt. When she was very young, she worked with her mother in this business, but now she is independent.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal plates to produce frying pans

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es un hombre muy trabajador de 50 años, vive con su esposa Gloria, de 40 años, y con su  última hija, Jacqueline de 11 años; sus 3 hijos mayores están en la capital (Lima) estudiando una carrera profesional. 

Desde muy joven la pasión por arreglar las cosas hicieron que la electrónica sea su oficio, por lo que emocionado Sergio dice: “tengo 35 años dedicándome a este trabajo, con el cual pago los estudios de mis hijos, pude construir mi casa y me hice de clientes que me estiman mucho que es lo más gratificante para mí”. Por nada del mundo quiere abandonar su trabajo, es por eso que para el futuro quiere abrir una sucursal de su negocio con el nombre “Electrónica Fernández II”, pues dice que toda la población sabrá de quién se trata. Por otro lado, también desea construir otra casa para que sus hijos tengan independencia.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que pagará responsable y puntualmente cada cuota, además trabajará activamente en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos repuestos para su taller; tale como componentes electrónicos y artefactos usados.
texts.en:
Sergio is a hardworking man of 50. He lives with his wife Gloria, 40, and their youngest daughter Jacqueline who is 11 years old. They have 3 grown children who are studying in the capital, Lima.

From the time he was very young, Sergio had a passion for fixing things, making it natural that he would work in electronics. Sergio says, emotionally, "I have 35 years dedicated to this work, and it has allowed me to pay for the education of my children, and build my house, and given me clients who hold me in high esteem which is the most gratifying for me". There is nothing in the world that would make him want to leave his work. In the future he wants to open a branch called Electronica F. II. He would also like to build another house so that his children will have some independence. This is the first loan with MFP, and he is sure he can make each payment on time. He also plans to work actively in the communal bank. This loan will be used to purchase supplies for his shop such as electronic components and used parts.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his shop such as electronic components and used parts

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerme tiene 58 años de edad, es oriunda de la selva peruana y tiene 6 hijos adultos. Su casa está construida a base de madera y se ubica en una zona árida al sur de la ciudad de Lima.
Las manualidades y la costura fueron las actividades a las que se dedicó durante casi toda su vida. Actualmente tiene una bodega que implementó en su vivienda, pero eso no quiere decir que dejó atrás la confección textil, pues tiene un espacio donde cose la ropa de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo está pendiente de la atención de su tienda.
Llerme es una mujer muy apasionada en lo que hace, y arreglar y parchar la ropa es lo mejor que sabe hacer, además le es muy rentable, ya que en su barrio no tiene competencia, pues es la única costurera.
Su mayor deseo es lograr construir su casa de material noble, pero aun no puede hacerlo porque no tiene el título de propiedad del terreno donde habita, y mientras las autoridades no les concedan estos documentos, no podrá construir su tan anhelada casa.

Anteriormente era parte de un grupo, pero éste se desintegró, por lo que ahora accede a su primer crédito de forma individual, comprometiéndose a ser puntual en sus pagos, como siempre lo ha sido. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará productos comestibles para su bodega. Así como también vaR. carretes de hilos especiales para su máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Llerme, 58, is originally from the Peruvian jungle; she has 6 adult children. Her house is primarily made of wood and is located in an arid area in the south of Lima. Most of her life she has made crafts and been a seamstress. Currently, she also has a small grocery store in her home. This doesn't mean, however, that she has abandoned her textile manufacturing because she has an area in her home where she makes clothing for her customers while tending to her store. Llerme is passionate about what she does and patching and repairing clothing is what she does best. Besides, this is quite profitable because she has no competition in her neighborhood; she's the only seamstress in the area. Her greatest desire is to build her house with more substantial materials. However, she can't begin to do this yet because she does not have title to the land where she lives and, as long as the authorities don't issue these documents, she won't be able to build her so-desired home. Previously, she was a member of a group. However, the group disolved so she is now requesting funds as an individual. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the funds to buy food items for her store and to buy several spools of special thread for her sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items for her store and spools of thread for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie S. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old and married with two school-age children. Lenie owns and operates a specialized retail store selling electronic load in the local community. She's been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Lenie joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Group D, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Bernald, shown at the top left and also in the group photo, is the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. He is 37 years old and married with nine children, the oldest being at the University and the others being in primary and secondary schools. He also takes care of four dependents.

Bernald is a businessman who has sold produce from Kyabiyorwa Upper Cell for thirty years. Some of his business challenges are the price fluctuations of agricultural products. He ensures that his produce is of good quality and hence wins more customers. His goal is to ensure that he gets his business to grow as well as have a good family.

With Bernald, once he does not have enough produce from his farm, he buys from other farmers to ensure that his customers remain with him. He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea L., age 31, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries, earning a gross income of $30 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a goldsmith, earning an income of $2.50 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since L. and her husband have had these businesses. L. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Señor Pan De Azucar De Sacllo Group

texts.es:
Sacllo está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los antiguos Inkas, Sacllo se caracteriza por tener zonas agrícolas y ganaderas, Un grupo de vecinas y amigas formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo”, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo, el banco comunal está conformado por 11 mujeres y 2 varones que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en las comunidad de Sacllo. Las actividades económicas de los socias a las que se dedican son por ejemplo a la venta de verduras, venta de comestibles, venta de frutas, venta de chicha, venta de leche, venta de golosinas y venta de animales menores y un socio brinda servicio de docencia.  Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Basilia forma parte del banco comunal “Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo”, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Basilia nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que está sacando adelante a sus hijos si ayuda de su pareja. Basilia se dedica a la venta de verduras, crianza de animales menores y venta de chicha de jora. Basilia requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores y semillas.   

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Sacllo is located in the district and province of Calca, within the Cusco department, in the heart of the sacred valley that was once occupied by the Incas. Sacllo is known for having many agricultural and livestock farms. Several years ago, a group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank, "Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo," which is currently in its 6th cycle. This communal bank is composed of 11 women and 2 men, all of whom are workers and business owners that are always looking for opportunities to move ahead and whom dedicate their daily hard work to being able to give their children a better future. It is a communal bank made up of members that live within the community of Sacllo. The following are some of the economic sectors that the members work in: the sale of vegetables, grocery items, fruits, chicha, milk, sweets, and baby animals, and one member provides teaching services. Cusco is known for being a charming city located in the Southern Region of Peru. It is popular for its archaeological monuments, its historical city center, its landscapes, and its history. Basilia is a part of the communal bank, "Señor de Pan de Azúcar de Sacllo." She is a single mother of three children. She tells us, with great pride, that she is able to provide her children with a brighter future without the help of her partner. Basilia sells vegetables and chicha, and works in the rearing of baby animals. She needs a loan so that she can purchase more baby animals and seeds. The members of her bank are thankful for the granted opportunity and they promise to fulfill the loan payments by the designated deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basilia plans to use the loan to purchase more baby animals and seeds.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: LA SRA. CARMEN  TRABAJA CON NUESTRA INSTITUCION DE MANERA MUY RESPONSABLE YA QUE SUS CREDITOS LOS PAGA CON MUCHA PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD COMO ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL TIENE EL INGRESO DE SU LIBRERIA LA MISMA QUE EMPEZO CON NUESTRO FINANCIAMINETO Y FUE DESDE AHI QUE LE EMPEZO A IR BASTANTE BIEN YA QUE EN ESTOS MOMENTOS CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO CON BASTANTE MERCADERIA, COMO SEGUNDA ACTIVIDAD TIENE UN AUTOMOVIL QUE LO TRABAJA UN CHOFER CUYOS INGRESOS QUE GENERA ES POR LA RENTA DE SU MOVILIDAD QUIEN TRABAJA EN TRUFI 1 DE LA ZONA, CON ESTAS ACTIVIDADES ES CON LAS QUE MANTIENE A TODA LA FAMILIA COMPUESTA POR LA MAMA, LA HERMANA Y SUS DOS HIJOS LOS CUALES AUN SON PEQUEÑOS, CONOCIENDO A LA SEÑORA LO TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE SE HIZO ACREEDORA DE LA TASA KIVA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA UNA FOTOCOPIADORA PARA OFRECER ESTE SERVICIO EN SU LIBRERIA. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carmen works with our institution in very responsible fashion. She always makes her payments responsibly and punctually. Her primary source of income comes from her bookstore, the same store that she opened through our financing. She got along fine in the beginning, and these days she can count on a business with ample merchandise. As a second form of income, she rents out her automobile to a driver who works in the city's share-taxi zone 1. In these ways she can maintain her family that includes her mother, her sister, and her sister's two small children. Knowing that Carmen is a hardworking and responsible woman, she was granted the Kiva lending rate. With this loan, she will buy a photocopier in order to offer the service in her bookstore. She is very grateful for Emprender and Kiva for having the confidence to make her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse of a photocopier

loans.name: Orlando Rafael

texts.es: El señor Orlando Rafael V.
texts.en:
Mr. Orlando Rafael Alvarez V. is 30 years old, married, and he lives with his wife in a neighborhood called Buenos Aires. She too is a merchant and adds income to the family economy. Orlando dedicates himself to the sale of second-hand and new clothes, and has also done electrical work. For more than 4 years, he has worked in the wholesale distribution of goods, supplying the capital's markets, while hoping for a better future. One of the greatest problems he has endured during his career, has been the lack of financial support that microfinance banks offer. Orlando has lacked the few resources that ensure good pay, but with the accessibility of Afodenic, and thanks to Kiva funds, he can now have access to a loan to purchase a larger inventory of merchandise, which will increase his sales volume and produce a higher income. This will allow for new investment in future sources of work that should, day by day, improve the level of life for him and all his family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR HIS CLOTHING SALES BUSINESS

loans.name: Adanyossi

texts.fr: T. Adanyossi est née en 1972 et est mariée à AYIDOHOME Lambert, un chauffeur. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a près de douze ans que Adanyossi s'est installée au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Adanyossi réside en effet avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Adanyossi n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis trente ans, Adanyossi mène comme activité, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile et aussi au marché de Allada. Adanyossi s'approvisionne à Agonmey et à Allada au Bénin. Adanyossi avait obtenu deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Adanyossi sollicite un troisième prêt afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus d'économie.
texts.en:
Adanyossi T. was born in 1972 and is married to Lambert AYIDOHOME, a driver. The couple has two children, both in school. Nearly twelve years ago Adanyossi moved to the Dogoudo neighborhood in Allada, in the Atlantic department. Adanyossi lives with her husband and children. The couple shares the different family responsibilities. Adanyossi did not attend school. For thirty years, Adanyossi has run a business selling charcoal from home and also at the Allada market. Adanyossi buys her supplies in Agonmey and Allada in Benin. Adanyossi had obtained two loans that were all repaid. In response to increasing demand from her clientele, Adanyossi is requesting a third loan to improve her business and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 17 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas agrícolas, en la actualidad trabaja junto a su esposo en el junto cultivando papa de diversas variedades, habas, oca y cebada, en sus propios terrenos. Asimismo cría cerdos, ovejas y vacas, y al cabo de dos meses son comercializados en la feria  ganadera de su localidad. De la misma forma, la cosecha que obtiene es llevada al mercado para su venta, obteniendo buenas ganancias. En adelante desea tener mas animales para aumentar su ganado y ampliar su siembra. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP,  es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras de este aporte que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para mejorar sus cultivos, así como cerdos y ovejas para aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene en su establo.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 28, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. She has been tied to farming all her life. Currently, she and her husband work farming various varieties of potato, broad beans, oca (a tuber) and barley on their own lands. She also raises pigs, sheep and cows which are sold in her area’s livestock fairs. Her farm crops are also taken to the market for sale, generating good profits. In the future, she’d like to have more animals to increase her cattle herds and she’d like to increase her plantings. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she’s very responsible with her payments; she is grateful to all the people who will contribute to this loan that will be very useful for the success of her business. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure to improve her crops as well as to buy pigs and sheep to increase the number of animals in her stable.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep as well as sacks of manure for her crops.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen C. is a widow who lives in Vista Alegre, Barangay Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling glassware and selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes. Carmen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, Carmen is borrowing PHP 13,000 which she intends to use to buy stock for her businesses so that she can continue to save for the future renovation of her house. Carmen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams.
