They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy stock for her businesses

loans.name: Beng Ntoh

texts.en:
Born in 1968, Beng Ntoh L. is married and has two children. He was encouraged to become a GHAPE member in 2007 as he was finding it too difficult to take care of his family and he was looking for business capital. Also, he has been having a lot of marital problems with his wife. This has made him feel sad all the time but he is appreciative of the fact that he is alive. His desire is to give his children love and education. He states that he feels better each time he provides something for his children.

Since 2007, he has taken and repaid two loans and has proven himself to be very hardworking. His inability to get investment capital, which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs, is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

Given a loan, he plans to buy palm nuts, groundnuts and farm tools for sale. These articles are in high demand in his area. He knows this business will succeed because he is located at a good business site. He plans to use the profits generated to sponsor his children in school and to cater for the basic needs of his family. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts, groundnuts and farm tools

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 28 years old and married with two children: Belinda 8 and Shifa 3.  She has been selling clothes for two years.  She learned the skills for running her own business when she was previously employed in a boutique.  

She appreciates Faulu Kenya for training her in business management skills.  She has also benefited from Faulu Kenya through the Pambazuko group because she can save her money with them.  Besides, she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya.  

She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to increase her stock.  She hopes to expand her business and invest in a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa T. is 42 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Palepa has many years of experience in this business.  Palepa needs a loan of WST 1500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Palepa joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Palepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rukhsoramo

texts.en:
Rukhsoramo is a widowed mother. She has a daughter. She sells nice, quality fabrics for national dresses in a big local market. She started this business a year ago. Rukhsoramo would like to ask for a loan of $1200 USD to increase her inventory stock. She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Rukhsoramo’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Wilson Peter

texts.es:
Wilson de 52 años, tiene un taller de soldadura y metales, vive en una zona caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes comerciantes llamada Guasmo. 

Empezó hace 11 años como soldador de puertas y ventanas, poco a poco aprendió de la profesión en un taller, después de un tiempo se independizo y se dedico a aprender y a trabajar como soldador para poder mantener a su familia. Ahora el tiene su taller de soldaduras y metales. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar metales y herramientas para su taller. En el futuro quiere tener un taller mas grande y que sus cuatro hijos tengan un buen futuro económico.
texts.en:
Wilson is 52 years old and has a metal and welding shop. He lives in an area, called Guasmo, known for its number of resident merchants. He started 11 years ago as a doors and windows welder. Little by little he learned by working in another shop and eventually went out on his own so that he could support his family. Now he has his own welding shop and works from 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM daily. He will use the money from this loan to buy metal and tools for his shop. In the future he wants to have a larger shop. He also wants his children to have a good financial future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools and supplies

loans.name: Sambacounda Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois SAMBACOUNDA est créé depuis le 30 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 27 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elle se sont organisées par affinité et par proximité. Leurs principales activités sont la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, la vente d'huile de palme et de sucre.

Madame BAMBY B. à l'extrême droite sur la photo, vêtue de vert claire, est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a aussi en charge 2 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Son activité consiste la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle achète des arachide à l'état brute pour les griller et les transforme ensuite en pâte. Ses lieux d'écoulement de produits sont les marchés hebdomadaires de la localité. 

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter des arachides en quantité plus importante pour augmenter sa production afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices. 

Les objectifs visés par le prêt sont principalement la nourriture et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The “Banc Villageois” Sambacounda was created on December 30, 2008. It is made up of 27 women who all live in the same village. They organized themselves by affinity and proximity. Their main activities are the processing and sale of peanut paste, the sale of palm oil and sugar.

Mrs. Bamby B., standing on the far right of the photo dressed in pale green, is the President of the “Banc Villageois”. She is 43 year old; She is married and the mother of five children. She also is responsible for two other children left in her care by relatives.

Her activity is the processing and sale of peanut paste. She buys the raw unprocessed peanuts to roast them and transform them into paste. She sells her products at the weekly markets in her area.

Her loan will allow her to buy peanuts in larger quantities to increase her production in order to make a better profit.

The aims of this loan are mainly for food and school fees for her children.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts for processing into paste.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia K. is a 30 year old single mother to Brian Alwaka, 10 years old. She lives in Luanda town, a very busy town with a good strategic marketplace. Many people come from different places to sell their farm and horticulture products, and trade livestock. Many of these traders are customers of Lydia's business. 

She has been selling used clothes for the past two years,and earns a monthly income of Kshs 9,000. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the first loan, and intends to buy two bales of used clothes to sell during this peak season.

Her desire is to open up a boutique in the future and be able to pay fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Jhoan

texts.en:
Jhoan L. is from the village of Benhaan in Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 22 years old. Jhoan is married and has one young child. To make a living, Jhoan owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Jhoan has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jhoan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jhoan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jhoan is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jhoan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch M. is 50 years old and married.  She resides with her husband and six children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. M. produces traditional baskets to sell, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 1 per day. Mao has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month. M. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional savings to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco G. is from the village of Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old, married to Fe G. and they’re blessed with 3 children, some already married. To make a living, he is presently engaged in carpentry. He’s been engaged in this kind of labor for 5 years already. He is earning an average amount of not less than Php 3,500 a month from this work. 

In the year 2008, Francisco joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  As an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Francisco has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 40,000. He is requesting the same amount of Php 40,000 as his 4th loan which will be used for purchasing a second-hand motorcab to be attached to his single motorcycle to hire out. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments, and possible business expansion.
	

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of  motorcab to be attached to his motorcycle to hire out

loans.name: Shaaban

texts.ar:
شعبان متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في بيع واعادة تصنيع الخردة يحب عمله وله فيه حوالي 30 سنة يحب العمل الحر
الذي يعمل به لكنه يعاني صعوبة مادية كبيرة في تطوير عمله له تاريخ اقتراضي جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان يلقى
الدعم الكامل من العائلة ويريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء فان جديد لنقل الخردة حيث انه يجد
صعوبة كبيرة في نقلها على العربة يحب عائلته ويريد ان يتطور ويطور عائلته وان يكون يد فعالة في المجتمع
texts.en: Shaaban is married with two children. He sells and recycles scrap. Shaaban loves his job and has been in the field for thirty years. He enjoys the freedom of his work but suffers from great financial difficulties, which prevent him from enhancing his business. Shaaban has a good credit history with Al Majmoua. He has the full support of his family. Through his loan from Al Majmoua, Shaaban will purchase a new van to transport scrap. He loves his family and wants to secure a better future for them. He hopes to be a constructive member of society.

loans.use: To purchase a new van to transport scrap

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre D. familia D. 37 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una D. los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción D. frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado ovino. Ella cría ovejas en su domicilio, las alimenta en base a granos ay alimento balanceado y cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD.. Esta actividad es su principal fuente D. sustento, por ello siempre trata D. mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Actualmente ella desea adquirir más alimento y ovejas para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is a mother who is 37 years old and who lives together with her husband and children in one of the communities in the agricultural district of TambogranD.. It is a region of semi-tropical climate known primarily for the production of fruits, such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

She raises and sells sheep. She raises sheep from her property, feeding them basic grains and balanced feed. When they have reached a certain level of development she sells them to the merchants who visit the region where she lives. This business is her primary source of income, which is why she tries to maintain them in the best way possible. 

She wishes to acquire more feed and more livestock to improve her sales and her earnings. In order to reach her objective she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 800 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase feed and livestock.

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es:
Bartola, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, vive con sus 6 hijos y 2 nietos, también su esposo, ella se dedica a fabricar y vender hamacas, junto a sus hijos Bartola cada día fabrican hamacas, haciendo un promedio D. 6 en el mes, este ingreso que reciben D. sus ventas les ayuda a cubrir necesidades del hogar, ya que es una familia numerosa.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. hilo D. diferentes clases y colores, manguillos entre otros que son necesarios para fabricar las hamacas, este préstamo le ayudara a tener materiales suficientes para realizar los trabajos y salir con los pedidos.
Para Doña Bartola el principal objetivo es que sus hijos estudien para que puedan tener un futuro diferente y mejoren sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Bartola lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department, with her six children, two grandchildren and her husband.  She manufactures hammocks to sell.  Together with her children Bartola makes hammocks daily making on the average six per month.  Income from sales helps them cover household needs because they are a numerous family.

She is asking for funds to buy cordage of different colors and kinds as well as other items that are necessary to make hammocks.  The loan will help her have sufficient materials to do the jobs and fill all her orders.

Bartola’s main objective is that her children go to school so that they will have a different future and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy different colored cordage and other hammock making supplies.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa C., 51, is one person who definitely has the motivation to follow her dreams. She finished only high school but is confident that she will become a successful micro entrepreneur. Nicky, as she is called by friends, is married to Emildo, a motorcycle taxi driver. They reside in Parola, Binondo, at the heart of Manila and together they are raising three children. One of them studies in college, another is in elementary school, while the third stays at home.

Nicky has run her own sari-sari (variety) store at home for two years now. She sells goods at a cheap per-piece price to accommodate the immediate needs of her neighbors, such as a sachet of shampoo for an employee who needs to bathe before going to work, or a small amount of salt that a cook needs to season her food. Nicky is also into the buy and sell business. With these, she earns roughly PHP 11,000 per month.

To help her grow her business, Nicky has requested a loan of PHP 14,000. With this she plans to buy four sacks of rice, which she will repackage for retail. She also intends to purchase more grocery items to add to the various products on her store shelves. With this loan, she knows she will be able to earn more profits and save more.

Nicky's biggest challenge is that she has lists of debts that her customers sometimes fail to pay because of financial constraints. But being the determined micro entrepreneur that she is, she seeks a solution to this problem. This is all for the purpose of achieving her dream of having a profitable business, a good life, and a sustained education for her children.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of rice and groceries

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El señor Abelardo R. C. de 25 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Veronica Perez Garzon quien se dedica al hogar, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad que se llama Leandro. El señor Abelardo es de la localidad del Paso de la Reyna esta situado en el municipio de Santigo Jamiltepec en el estado de Oaxaca.
El señor Abelardo se dedica a la compra de cerditos para engordar para despues venderlos a las carnicerias o las personas que necesiten alguno de estos animales. 
El tiene cuatro años realizando esta actividad ya anteriormente se dedciaba a la agricultura a la cosecha de maiz.
Abelardo solicito el prestamo para poder comprar mas cerditos y engrandecer su criadero y asi vender mas y tener mas ganancias para que asi pueda mantener a su esposa y a su hijo ya que el sueña que su hijo tenga una profesion para que pueda tener mas oportunidades de trabajo no sufra tanto como el que ahi ocasiones en que no ahi ventas y tienen que abstenerse a muchas cosas.
El agradece a Dios por todas las bendiciones que le dá y tambien a las personas que apoyan a FRAC para que sigan realizando prestamos a personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Mr. Abelardo R. C. is 25 years old and married to Mrs. Veronica Perez Garzon who works in the home. They have a 1 year old son named Leandro. Mr. Abelardo is from Paso de la Reyna in the city of Santiago Jamiltepec in the state of Oaxaca.

Mr. Abelardo works buying piglets to fatten and later sell to butchers or other people who want them. He has been doing this work for four years and previously worked harvesting corn.

Abelardo is asking for a loan to be able to buy more piglets to increase his numbers and be able to sell more and earn more money. In this way, he will be able to support his wife and their son. He dreams that his son will someday be a professional so that he will have more opportunities for employment and not struggle as he sometimes has when sales are down and they have had to do without many things.

He is thankful to God for all of the blessings He gives him and also to the people who support FRAC so that they can keep loaning money to those who need it.

loans.use: To buy pigs for sale

loans.name: Alba Nery

texts.es:
Al lado de su madre y su familia conformada por su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, Alba Nery T. oriunda del municipio de Andes Colombia decidió emprender camino hacia Medellín con el fin de buscar un mejor futuro, fue entonces cuando con los pocos ahorros que tenía inició su propio negocio al que no pudo encontrarle un mejor nombre que “Tienda la Esperanza”, ya que éste se convirtió en la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y salir adelante. 

Alba necesita de un crédito para comprar surtido, lograr tener más inventario y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alba Nery T. is from a town in the Colombian Andes. Along with her mother, husband, and four children, she decided to move to Medellín in search of a better future. When she arrived, Alba used what little savings she had to start her own business. One could not find a better name for her shop, “Tienda La Esperanza” (Store of Hope). She has taken advantage of this opportunity to improve her quality of life and move forward.

Alba needs a loan to buy an assortment of merchandise so that she can have more inventory and offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Karlen

texts.en:
Karlen A. is 35 years old, and he lives with his parents in Geghamavan village, in the area of Sevan. 

Karlen works for the police and at the same time he is engaged in farming. He has 13 years of experience in animal breeding and land cultivation. Karlen raises cows, calves and sheep at his farm, and he also grows potatoes and grain. Karlen’s parents help him in his occupation and thus they solve their family’s needs.

Karlen is asking for a 1.000.000 Armenian drams loan to repair the cow barn and to buy some calves for his farm. This is Karlen’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to repair cow barn and to buy some calves for his farm

loans.name: Talat's Group

texts.en:
Talat is 40 years old, married to F. M. and lives in a small city in Pakistan called Chichawatni. She resides in a three-room brick house with her husband and four children: two boys and two girls. Three of them are enrolled in a local school while youngest one has not started attending school yet.  Talat is a working woman as well as a housewife. She manages her household responsibilities and takes care of her children. She also sells embroidered clothes to her neighborhood clients. She purchases them from a city called Multan. The earned profits help her pay school fees for her children and utilities expenses.
 
Her husband is a fruit vendor who operates a shop in the market. He believes in quality and provides fresh seasonal fruits for his clients to purchase.Talat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who will invest that money in his business. Through the loan, he will purchase fresh seasonal fruits that will help him attract more customers and make more profit. Talat is hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded by making positive use of the loan. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years and Talat has full confidence in him. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Talat.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Tulga

texts.en: Tulga is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia. His younger son goes to a local secondary school. Tulga works at a Customs House as a driver. Besides his work he manages a clothing trading business with the help of his wife. He is planning to expand and continue this business. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bernard Gichongoro

texts.en:
Bernard has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 39 years old, married to Jane Njeri and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Bernard hopes to become a leading farmer in the Naivasha area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 25-year-old mother of two beautiful girls. She has been married to Mohammad, a salesman, since 2007 and has been living in a rented house in Al Zarqa. Rania is a very ambitious young lady who saw the opportunity to start a small retail business at home selling clothes five years ago. During these five years, she added home products as another thing that she sells. Now Rania has applied for a loan to add more variety in the clothes she sells so she can save enough money from the profit to open her own independent store.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Nena works hard to support her family.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.   Nena is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish business.  

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children. 
Armida is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 7 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and to pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service.
Armida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Armida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for the utilities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is 35 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband has a soft drink corner in the nearby market where he serves his customers with chilled drinks and generates income for the family. 

Sajida is a very cooperative lady. She supports her husband financially by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. Her sewing skill earns her a good amount of income every month, which she utilizes to manage her household expenses. 

Her children are young and study in different classes by attending a local school. 

Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to invest it in his soft drink business. With the loan, he will buy soft drinks like Coca Cola, Pepsi, Sprite etc. to be able to sell to his customers and generate more income. 

Sajida is very hopeful that after the loan investment, his business will grow in a positive direction. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sajida".

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
This is Lea, 32, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is a mother of one and married to Renato, a security guard. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lea operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. Lea earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 533 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and charcoal to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Lea hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her child a high quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products for her store

loans.name: Rosa Elsy

texts.es: Rosa Elsy tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos y libros. Hace más de 3 años se ha dedicado en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que realiza todos los días en su comarca, le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo y eso la hace sentirse independiente y con esperanzas de darle un futuro mejor a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poner un negocio más estable, pero por el momento se siente tranquila con su trabajo. Ella solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo lápiz labial, pintura, cremas, tratamientos, pintura de uñas polvos entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Elsy is 37 years old and has a business in which she sells cosmetics and books. She has been selling cosmetics for more than three years and works every day in her region. Rosa enjoys her work very much because she has the time to devote to it, it allows her to be independent, and it enables her to provide a better future for her family. Her greatest wish is to have a more stable business, but at the moment she feels at peace with her work.

Rosa is requesting this loan to use as operating capital for buying lip pencils, nail polish, crèmes, treatments, powders, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase lip pencils, nail polish, crèmes, treatments, powders, and other products.

loans.name: Leticia Martha

texts.es:
Leticia tiene 48 años y 3 años en el negocio de tienda y cabinas telefónicas. Ella inició vendiendo alitas de pollo asadas y bebidas gaseosas. Al ver que poco a poco se daba a conocer en este negocio incrementó varias cosas mas como arroz, enlatados, embutidos etc, así adicionó al negocio la tienda de abarrotes.

Trabaja sola de 8:00 am a 20:00pm, pero cuenta que la zona en la que vive es muy insegura lo que la hace estar muy alerta de no ser asaltada. A pesar de que es soltera y no tiene niños ella lucha para salir adelante y apoyar a su familia que son sus padres. Su objetivo por ahora es conseguir un préstamo para abastecer su negocio. Se ve en el futuro con una gran distribuidora.
texts.en:
Leticia, age 48, has had a store and telephone booths for three years.  She started selling chicken wings and soft drinks.  Upon seeing that, little by little, she was learning this business, she added several other things like rice, canned goods, and sausages, etc.  That is how she added a grocery store to her business.

She works alone from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  However, she tells us that the area where she lives is very unsafe.  This makes her very alert so that she is not assaulted.  Even though she is single and does not have children, she struggles to get ahead and help her family, meaning her parents.

Her objective now is to get a loan to stock her business.  She looks to be a big distributor in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and various products to stock her store.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Adela; tiene 42 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 4 hijos; el conyugue de la socia trabaja vendiendo zapatillas y la socia le apoya en la compra de mercadería y también en la venta; La socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y junto a sus conyugue ahorran el dinero que les ingresa de las ventas y pagan las cuentas de casa y los estudios de sus hijos, la socia algunas veces viaja a traer la mercadería a Juliaca o a Lima, y otras veces va su conyugue, los dos también venden turnándose los horarios y en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de mercadería, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete con cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the “FUENTE DE VIDA” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.  

The associate, Adela, is 42 years of age and lives in a shared home.  She has 4 children.  Her partner works selling shoes and she supports him by purchasing the merchandise and also selling shoes.  The associate is a very hard-working woman and, along with her partner, saves the money that they earn from the sales to pay for the household expenses  and the studies of her children.  The associate sometimes travels to bring the merchandise to Juliaca or to Lima.  At other times her partner goes.  The two also sell by taking turns on the schedule.  On this occasion the associate desires to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise. The associate requests the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise.
  
 The associate is happy for the support offered and promises to comply with the payment schedule in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: La Sra. santusa vive en la localidad D. la Guardia, hace unos 25 años que se vino a vivir a dicha localidad, su esposo es D. ocupación albañil el se dedica hace unos 40 años a esta actividad, tienen dos hijos a su cargo ya que tres D. sus hijos son independientes, los cuales le colaboran en su economía, su actividad principal es la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, es decir venta D.  barrio, en su propio domicilio, y también venD. en la puerta D. un  colegio D. la zona por donD. vive hace unos seis años que se dedica a este negocio, el destino del crédito es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, como ser la compra D. : arroz, aceite, harina, dulces, galletas, sodas, etc., se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo financiero que se le brinda, por lo tanto así han podido salir adelante y D. esta manera mejorar su economía y por enD. su calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Santusa lives in the town of La Guardia.  She came to live in this area 25 years ago.  Her husband is a bricklayer and has been in that profession for about 40 years.  They have two dependent children since three are now on their own.  Their children help them with their finances.  Her main business is selling essential items.  In other words, she sells in her neighborhood from her own home and she also sells at the door of a local school.  She has been in this business for about six years.  This loan is intended to increase her working capital, allowing her to buy things such as rice, oil, flour, candy, cookies, sodas, etc.  She thanks the institution for the financial support they offer her, which has allowed her to get ahead by improving her finances and, as a result, her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, oil, flour, and cookies to stock her store

loans.name: Amparo De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Amparo tiene 61 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos.

Ella se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Hasta la fecha tiene 4 años de estar atendiendo su negocio, ella es una persona muy activa que conoce su negocio y lo que los clientes necesitan. Antes ella se dedicaba a la crianza de especies menores como ganillas y cerdos.

La señora Amparo solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más productos, como: huevos, frijoles, arroz, aceite, entre otros más. De esta forma ella surtiría su tienda y cubriría la demanda de sus clientes, quedándole disponible  un buen margen de ganancias, el cual le permitiría mejorar su condición de vida.

Ella desea ver su tienda bien surtida y fuerte en la comunidad donde vive. Además, ella piensa poner una granja de pollos de engorde y de esta forma otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Amparo is 61 and she lives with her three children.  She has her own business selling basic supplies.  She has had the business for 4 years and she is very active, knows the business well, and knows what the customers need.  Before opening the store she raised small animals such as hens and pigs.

Amparo is requesting a loan from the Campo Foundation to buy products such as: eggs, beans, rice, oil, and more.  With these she will supply her store and cover her customers’ requests, giving her a good margin on the sales which will allow her to improve her living conditions.

She would like to have a well-stocked and well-run store in the community where she lives.  Besides, she is thinking of setting up a chicken farm where she can fatten them and thus have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy eggs, beans, rice, cooking oil, and other products for her store

loans.name: Las Rosas 4 Group

texts.es:
Santa es una D. los miembros del grupo Las Rosas 4, compuesto por 5 mujeres dinámicas y motivadas a trabajar para salir adelante junto a sus familias y comunidad.  Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una comunidad D. pocos recursos localizada al norte D. L. capital D. L. República Dominicana. 

Santa junto a su esposo se dedican a L. compra D. metales, como hierro para revenderlos en el mercado D. chatarras, las cuales serán reutilizadas para alguna finalidad. Compran toda clase D. metales, que se encuentran desechados en las calles, casas, empresas, entre otros, esto a parte D. ayudarles con sus ingresos, también ayuda al medio ambiente y a las familias o antiguos propietarios que no sabían que hacer con esas piezas. Santa también se dedica a L. venta D. productos misceláneos.

Este es su segundo préstamo, por lo cual esta muy motivada D. recibirlos, y lista para tener un nuevo capital para sus negocios.  Sus planes para el futuro es poder establecer al menos uno D. sus negocios, y que este pueda ser prospero, y sostenible, D. modo que pueda suplir sus necesidades y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Santa is one of the members of the group Las Rosas 4, which is maD. up of five dynamic women who are motivated to work to get ahead with their families and community.  This group is located in the city of Santo Domingo, a community with few resources located north of the capital of the Dominican Republic.

Santa works with her husband to purchase metals, such as iron, to resell them at the scrap metal market where they will be reused for something.  They buy all types of metals that they find thrown out in the streets, at houses, businesses, and other locations.  In addition to helping them with their income, this also helps the environment and the families or older storekeepers who don't know what to do with these items.  Santa also works selling miscellaneous products.

This is her second loan.  She is very motivated to receive it, and she is ready to have a new source of capital for her businesses.  Her plan for the future is to be able to establish at least one of her stores, and that it is able to be prosperous and sustainable so that she can proviD. the necessities and help her family.

loans.use: to purchase used or scrap metal (iron, bronze, aluminum).

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида замужем имеет одну дочь. Муж строитель. 11 лет она занимается торговлей национальных и хлопчатобумажных  тканей. У нее свои постоянные клиенты. Фарида торгует на протяжении многих лет на одной точке. Приближается зима. Следует поменять ассортимент своего товара. Для этого нужны средства. Она хочет получить займ и увеличить свой товар за счет зимних тканей для шитья национальных женских одежд. Фарида надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Farida is married and has one daughter.  Her husband is a construction worker.  She has been involved in selling national and cotton fabrics for 11 years.  She has her own loyal customers.  Farida has been working at the same retail outlet for many years.  Now that the winter is approaching, she wants to replace her merchandise assortment and needs funds for this.  She wants to obtain a loan and increase her goods inventory with winter fabrics for sewing national women's clothing.  Farida hopes to receive your help.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials for sewing national women's clothing

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has 3 children. Sergio owns a fishing boat that he uses to go fishing. He is able to provide for his family's basic needs through his income. He works hard to improve his business so that he can sustain his children's education.

Sergio has requested a loan to purchase fish nets and other materials. He hopes to earn more so he can pay his children's school fees and make improvements to the family's house.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other materials

loans.name: Kuña Renda San Muiguel Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Caaguazú se juntaron, para que por medio del trabajo en conjunto D. ellas puedan salir adelante y ser útiles no solo a ellas mismas sino también a sus familias. Mediante el trabajo en conjunto ya están en el cuarto ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación
Una mujer muy trabajadora es la señora Catalina, nos comenta que muy temprano se levanta todo los días para poner en orden su almacén ya que desD. muy tempranas horas ya tiene clientes aguardándola. Por medio D. este negocio ella pueD. cubrir los gastos D. su familia, ya que su meta es darles todo lo mejor. Ella solicita la ayuda D. kiva y fundación paraguaya para poder seguir con su negocio, para que pueda comprar huevos, aceite, fideo, verduras, leche y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fifteen women in the city of Caaguazú united so that they, through their work as a group, would be able to get ahead and be useful not only to themselves but also to their families. Through their work together they are now in the fourth loan cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras Program of Fundación Paraguaya.

One very hardworking woman is Sra. Catalina who tells us that she gets up very early everyday in order to get her grocery store ready, since she has customers waiting for her at very early hours of the morning. Through this business, she is able to cover her family’s expenses since her goal is to give them  the best of everything.  She is requesting help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya in order to be able to continue with her business. She will buy eggs, oil, noodles, vegetables, milk and other items to stock her store and meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy eggs, oil, noodles, vegetables, milk and other items.

loans.name: S Farmers Initiative A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from S Farmers initiative A Group in Western Kenya! Alice is the facilitator of the S Farmers initiative A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alice takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and due to one acre Fund's best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 15 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of S Farmers initiative A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Alice is pictured in the photo above with her group members and the Field Officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years. He is 38 years old, married to Ann, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer as well as farm inputs for use in his farm.

In future, Elijah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer seeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Wiliva

texts.en:
Wiliva is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Wiliva is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Wiliva owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Wiliva is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of her motorcycle.

In 2010, Wiliva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to maintain and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Shongamiti Group

texts.en:
Evidence is a 47 year old lady from Masvingo, Zimbabwe.  She is married with three children aged 23, 17, and 15 years.  All of them are still going to school.  She does not have any other dependents that live with her.  Her husband is employed by First Mutual as an agent and they have his salary as additional income.

She is in the business of buying and selling clothes which she imports from Zambia.  She has been in the business for four years and she is operating from her residence.  She has requested a loan of $400.00 to buy clothes that she can resell.  With the income from this loan, Evidence will be able to look after her family without any difficulties.  Evidence says the challenge she faces in the business is competition from established fashion retail shops.  She is planning to open a clothing factory for herself.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is into gari production. Gari is made out of cassava. Abena sells the gari at Akonoma near Cape Coast, which she has done for some years now. She is married to an auto electrician and has two children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. Abena will use her loan to purchase cassava to produce her gari to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase cassava to produce gari to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Speaking with Anne, it becomes obvious that she is a very hard-working and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kitale, along with a handsome husband and their four angelic looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. 

She has been doing agriculture for 7 years now. She makes money selling produce from her farm, including milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her as well as poor productivity. Anne is seeking a loan to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer, which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. 

Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Anne and her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 56 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erna has a personal care products business in the Philippines. Erna requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to sell.

Erna has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Erna would like to Save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
48 year-old Shakir is married and has 2 children. He is from occupied Lachin region of Azerbaijan. 

Shakir began his business 6 years ago. He is the only income earner of his family who supports his family via selling fruits.

Shakir would like to make some remodeling in his business, to buy digital scales and add a new vegetable section.Therefore he applies for the loan amount of $400.  

Shakir hopes that with this remodeling his sales will increase. He is sure that his good business skills will be very helpful for him in repaying the loan back.

loans.use: To purchase digital scales,open a new vegetable section

loans.name: Thú

texts.en:
Mrs Thu is 68 years old. Her husband died a long time ago. Now she lives with her son, who is 39 years old. Her son is a day laborer but the work is not stable.

She doesn’t have any land for cultivation so it is difficult for her family to earn a living. She has to sell noodles for breakfast to earn a living. She wants to borrow US $75 for this business.

loans.use: To sell noodles for breakfast

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and selling of condiments

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan is an IDP from occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He started his business in 2000, and borrowed Normicro loan with $450 amount from Baku branch. After some years he collected a sufficient number of customers and he feels a great need in modern equipment ( big mirror, fan, chair etc), and he is willing to borrow 1200$ to put his plans in reality.

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Manteheh

texts.en:
Manteneh is fifty years old and married with five children. Her husband is ill and unable to work, so Manteneh is the sole provider for the family. Her previous loan enabled her to purchase supplies wholesale because of which she made a good profit. She said she used part of the profit to purchase corrugated iron for building a restaurant shelter and used some for the children’s school fees.

Manteneh sells mainly cooked rice with beans, cooked cassava leaves and fish outside her home in Yogomaia, in the outskirts of Kabala Town of Sierra Leone. She is requesting $200 to increase her little restaurant's offerings and cope with the increased demand after the month of fasting when schools re-open.

loans.use: Increase her supplies for her restaurant business so that she can meet demand

loans.name: Alisi

texts.en: Alisi is new at the Levili Toefuataina borrowing centre. She is 22 years old and a mother of one child. Her business is operating a small shop in front of her house which is open every day from 7.00am – 6.00pm. She is planning to buy more inventory for her shop with her loan.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells clothing and shoes - she has been in this business since 2004. She is 29 years old and has four children. Felicia would be thankful for a loan of US$450 to be able to buy more clothing and shoes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Mugema E (I) Group

texts.en: Hadijah is 48 years old and married with four children. She sells vegetables and fruits in the market to earn a living. With the extra profits, she wants to buy a small plot of land.

loans.use: To expand her current business.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn O., 38, is married with two children and works selling duck eggs to the people in her area and usually makes about $3.20/day in revenue. Her husband operates a carnival balloon dart game and generally makes around $5 each day of income. Mrs. Norm O. hopes to use this loan to purchase more carnival items for her husband’s business. This will increase her entire family's income.

loans.use: To purchase more carnival items for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Islom

texts.en: Islom is 48 years old. He and his wife are raising four children, two of whom are still going to school. Islom has been a cattleman for 20 years. During these years he became a real expert in knowing which cattle to choose for breeding and how to raise them. He loves the animals and feels satisfied when he sees the results of his labor. Currently Islom has five cows for sale and is planning to purchase another two cows to raise. He shall also need to purchase the fodder they need. For all this Islom requests US$600.00 for  8 months. This is the first loan for Islom and he promises to repay it on time and thanks everyone for trusting and supporting him.

loans.use: To increase a cattle business

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Oeun M. and his wife have been married since 1979. They have five children; one son and four daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home.  The other three children work in a garment factory. The family lives along the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Oeun runs business in water supply distribution in the village. He has been doing this business for thirteen years. His wife has been a silk weaver for two years. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then sells the them in Phnom Penh.  

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a water pipeline and water pumping machine to run a business in water supply distribution.

loans.use: to purchase a water pipeline and water pumping machine to run a business in water supply distribution

loans.name: Sharifa's Mutakuja B Group

texts.en:
Sharifa O., age 32 is married, with one 14-year-old child. In 2005, she began her business of selling food. She works from 6am to 3pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $50. Sharifa appears in the picture standing in the middle of the back row.

Sharifa is requesting a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase sales in her food business. Sharifa plans to share this loan with her subgroup members, who have a salon that also sells food, sell charcoal, and a clothing shop.

loans.use: Increase food sales

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. sells clothing, panties, mosquito coils, and cell phone unit transfers. She is single and has two children, yet her income is insufficient to pay for her and her children's daily living expenses.

Nonetheless, demand for her goods is high, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business to thereby increase her profits. For that reason, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Sareta

texts.en:
Sareta S., 56, is married with 8 children. She has 4 years of experience in the sewing business. Her business serves the people in her village 5 days per week.

Sareta has never had a loan with SPBD before. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Sareta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy needles, materials and thread to help run her business.

loans.use: To buy needles, materials, and thread.

loans.name: Aissatou Illo

texts.fr:
Aissatou Illo N., 31, married and raising 4 children, has been a member of the Santhiaba Mosquée village bank for 7 years. Her business consists in buying and re-selling spare parts (motors, axles, chassis, etc.) It is a business that she has been active in for several years with the help of her husband who is also in this line of work. She wants to bolster her business to improve the living conditions and health of her family. Aissatou is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed in one single payment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Aissatou Illo N., 31 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Santhiaba Mosquée depuis 7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des pièces détachées ( moteurs, ponts, sassy, croix et autres). C’est une activité qu’elle mène depuis plusieurs années avec l’aide de son mari qui évolue dans le même secteur. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Aissatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Spare parts sales

Commerce de pièces détachées

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena D. is 60 years old, a wife and mother of four children. Only one of them is in school now. She has been selling grocery products for ten years in the town to support her family. She says business is doing well and she therefore wants to use this loan to buy more products to increase her inventory.

Abena believes this loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her last child who is in school still. She is a member of the group called Anointed Ladies. Members in this group agree in unison to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc.

loans.name: Laitalie

texts.en: Laitalie L., 45, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the handicrafts equipments business. She sells to the village people 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Laitalie's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to buy equipment used in her business and her husband and children help out.

loans.use: Laitalie would like to purchase tmaterials and equipment used for her business

loans.name: Nadhariu

texts.en:
Nadhariu M. has been selling homemade food items in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She works for ten hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $50 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ingredients for the local foods that she prepares and sell. If this loan helps her to increase her profit, she intends to put the extra money towards school fees for her children and food for her family.

Nadhariu is 30 years old, married, and has five children, aged 13, 12, 10, and 6 years, and one 2-month-old.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the foods she prepares.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia A. is 26 years old. She is married with two children who are both in school. 

Eugenia runs a provision shop in her community. She has been in this business for two years. She says she buys her goods from cities where the prices are quite affordable. 

Eugenia wants to expand her shop to meet the increasing demand of her customers.  She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Eugenia belongs to a group called “Peace” in her community. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk such as boxes of assorted biscuits, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheap T. lives in Tavak village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a housewife who is a good cook, preparing very delicious food for the family. Her husband, Mr. Meas Samorn, works in the Department of Rural Development and makes a small salary to support the family. He now wants to start a business to improve the family's living conditions.

Thus, Mrs. Pheap T. decided to ask for a loan to add to her saving and buy a rice mill to provide a service to the villagers. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. She is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is a one year old.

loans.use: To buy rice mill to provide a service the villagers.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 23 year old engaged man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Samer has been repairing cars for five years. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Samer first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage and he didn’t have the startup capital, but now he plans to improve and expand his business. 
He has requested a loan of 900 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his garage and to pay his wedding expenses. This is his second cycle and he has paid the first on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his garage and to pay his wedding expanses.

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
Sandra G. es una dama muy esforzada cuya labor es la actividad de pulpería que posee en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica a atender vendiendo todo tipo de productos desde comestibles, personales hasta productos del hogar.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de los productos y por este motivo es que espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Sandra Gomez is a strong woman who works in the general store she owns. Her store is in the main market of the city of Chinandega. She is dedicated to serving her clients and offers all kinds of products, from food and personal items to products for the home. It is important to note that she is seeking financial help from Ceprodel in order to purchase more products for her store. She hopes she will be awarded this loan in order to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products for her store

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
H. is 49 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has seven children: the first two are married and live separately, the second two work with her husband, and the last three are students. H. is married to Din, 50, who works at gathering stones to sell; he gathers them from the mountain far from the village.

H. is a local farmer on a big plot of farmland inherited from her parents which she has always harvested for customers twice a year since 2000. To help the family's income, H. also raises piglets in the pigpen behind her house.

H. is tired of hiring her neighbor's buffalo to plow her farmland. So she is looking for a loan to buy a pair of buffaloes for her plowing. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffaloes for her plowing

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift sells kerosene in her shop located at Kasidi, Okoko in Lagos State. Gift has four children and she is 35 years old. Gift is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
K. Muhabbat has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2009 but she describes herself as a serious and reliable client. Muhabbat is engaged in commercial service so she trades in material used for making the national dress. She works with direct suppliers from China and Iran. 

Muhabbat also is engaged in the livestock business.  The material selling business brings in her general income. Muhabbat has 6 years of experience in the material business. She is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 1600 TJS for 6 months, to be used for importing new wares.

loans.use: Importing new dressmaking material

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita L.,44 years old, is from La-o Santa Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 5 kids. The family works hard for a living. They are comfortable with their fish selling business. She seeks assistance from Paglaum Multi Purpose to finance her business.  Recently, she applied PHP 20,000.  She would like to maintain a record as a Member in Good Standing. She hopes to have her house repaired with savings from their fish selling livelihood.

loans.use: additional working capital for fish selling

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro que cuenta con 62 años de edad,  vive en su propia que se encuentra ubicada en la zona oeste de la localidad, vive junto a su esposa de 52 años respectivamente. Sus hijos que ya son mayores lo visitan cada fin de semana. Pedro se dedica a la venta de plásticos, abarrotes y otros de manera ambulante y en la misma venta de abarrotes que maneja su esposa. Ambas actividades en su misma casa donde viven y con sus buenos años de experiencia. La verdad que la competencia es mediana en ambos negocios, ya que están ubicados en muy buena zona y principalmente en su misma vivienda, además por los años de antigüedad en los mismos tienen sus clientes ya establecidos. Pedro ha invertido todo su crédito en lo que tenía previsto, es decir: abarrotes y plásticos. 
Este es el tercer préstamo de Pedro y todos los anteriores los ha cancelado excelentemente. Él tiene una pequeña deuda en otra entidad financiera que ya esta por terminar y de una forma muy puntual.
texts.en:
Pedro is 62 years old. He lives in his own place that is located in the western area of town. He lives with his 52-year-old wife. Their children are already grown and they visit every weekend. Pedro works selling plastics, groceries and other products as a street vendor and in the same place he wife also sells groceries. Both activities are done in their own house and they have many years of experience. The truth is that both businesses are relatively competitive, since they are located in a good area and mainly run out of their own home. In addition, now they have established clients. Pedro has invested his entire loan in what he proposed, which is to say: groceries and plastics. This is Pedro's third loan and all of his previous ones have been paid back. He has a small loan with another financial institution that is almost up and has been paid in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He plans to invest capital in plastics and groceries.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn A. is 43 years old and a resident of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City in the southern part of the Philippines. She is married to Doming A. and blessed with three school-age children, ages 17, 14, and 13. Her husband works as a farmer on their small parcel of land.

Merlyn sells "banana cue", "camote cue" (homemade snack foods) and other tasty dishes through peddling. Her business has been up and running for about three months now. Every day, she sells her goods in their neighborhood and nearby villages. She earns approximately Php 100 daily, six days a week; Sunday is for family and church day.

Merlyn wants to expand her business by cooking some other varieties of "viands" (tasty dishes). She is applying for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 5,000 to purchase additional ingredients. With this amount, she can sell more food to her "suki" (regular customers) and gain higher income. If granted, this will be her first loan with HSPFI.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for dishes to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Fanny Mercedes

texts.es: Fanny Mercedes F. Jiménez, tiene 29 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos,  no posee escolaridad alguna. Igual que otras mujeres trabajadoras y madre esforzada, trabaja de forma independiente comercializando mercadería varias entre estas: ropa, calzado, ropa interior, perfumes, cremas. Su forma de ofrecer sus productos es de manera ambulante entregando a sus clientes la mercadería con formas de pago accesibles, ya sean mensuales o quincenales. Ella adquiere los productos de venta en Managua esto implica viajar muchos kilómetros hacia la capital. Anteriormente ella ha recibido financiamiento de parte de la Fundación y esto le ha hecho mejorar su negocio es por eso que tiene la voluntad de continuar trabajando con nosotros, para poder crecer aun mas y así mejorar su nivel de vida. Sus metas radican en poder crecer como comerciante y así establecerse en el mercado de manera más formal  y adquirir más conocimiento en su trabajo para mejorar su financiamiento.
texts.en:
Fanny Mercedes F. Jiménez is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She does not have any formal education whatsoever. Like other hard-working mothers, she works independently selling a variety of merchandise such as: clothing, shoes, underwear, perfumes and creams. She distributes her products by hand to her customers, offering them flexible payment options such as monthly or bi-monthly. She buys her products in Managua, which involves a trip of many kilometers to the capital city. She had previously received financial assistance from Fundación, and this allowed her to make improvements to her business. She has a wish to continue working with us, to grow her enterprise even more, and therefore elevate her standard of living. Her goals are to grow as a merchant and establish herself in the market in a more formal manner. She also wants to learn more about business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
T. Vũ Thị (525980647) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three adult children.

T. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 5,100,000 VND a month.

In 1998, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Vista Al Mar Grupo 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria H. is moving on to her second loan with Esperanza. She successfully completed her first loan by investing in her store, known as a colmado. Colmados are basically little grocery stores that dot the corners of most villages. Maria owns a little colmado, and with the loan she was able to grow her business with both improvements to the existing store and by selling a larger variety of products.

Prior to coming to Esperanza, Maria was raising four children aged 19, 15, 13, and 11 on a limited income from her small colmado. Maria came to Esperanza because she knew if she could get a loan to invest in her business she could significantly increase her income. This increase in income would allow her to make improvements in all aspects of her life, most importantly with her children.

Since her first loan, she has maD. minor improvements to her home and store. She bought a freezer for her store which allows her to sell more products. In her home, she now has running water and a door. These minor improvements have encouraged her to come back to Esperanza for another loan so she can replicate her success.

loans.use: Improvements and purchase of more products for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a member of the Bwawani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 40 yeras old woman,she is married and  a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 16,12,08 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.
Hidaya started her own grocery business 10 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 400,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Hidaya`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer,soda.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Hidaya hopes to save more money,get more food for family,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy N. is a villager in Trapaing Khlout village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and corns. Now she has a problem because she does not have enough money to support her corn growing. Thus, she needs a loan to buy corn seeds and pesticides to support the corn field. Her husband, Mr. Muong Saroeun, transport the coconuts to sell. Mrs. Sophy N. is 30 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds and pesticides to support the corn field.

loans.name: Aldo Rene

texts.es: El joven Aldo O. de 28 años de edad soltero vive en el barrio laureles norte en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de siete y cuatro años de edad, brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos es una de las prioridades que  tiene, siendo unos de sus planes el crecimiento de su panadería que desde hace once años ofrece excelente servicio y calidad, al iniciar fue muy difícil establecer la clientela, la profesión la heredo de su padre ya que era la fuente de su trabajo y de subsistir. El préstamo que solicita lo requiere para comprar materias primas como: harinas, levadura, caja de manteca, azúcar,  bolsas de empaque, sartenes para ofrecer sus ricos productos. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo ya que es una gran oportunidad de seguir creciendo como microempresa.
texts.en:
Aldo O. is a 28-year-old, single, father of two sons, aged seven and four. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. His priorities are to provide the best for his sons and one of his plans is the expansion of his bakery which has been offering excellent service and product quality for the past 11 years. At first, it was very difficult to establish a client base since he inherited the profession from his father and it was his sole source of income. The requested loan will be used to purchace raw materials like: flours, yeast, lard, sugar, packing materials, and baking pans to offer his delicious products. He is grateful to the institution for the loan since this offers a great opportunity to continue growing as a microbusiness.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, lard, packing materials and other supplies for bread production.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
For the last six years, Josefina has maD. a living managing a general store located in front of her house. She wants to make her business more productive and profitable, and has applied for a loan for PHP10,000 to expand her store so she can better help her family pay its bills and have the best life possible. She will use this loan to buy a range of items she can sell to her customers.

Josefina is 50 years old, married and lives with her husband and their four children in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela.

loans.use: To expand her small store

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito T., 36, is from the city of Bitoon Ozamiz City.  He is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecito owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" retail store.
